You sighed but smiled at her. "Hey, Meryl. Still finding that joke funny, are you?"

"Of course. Have you learned nothing from our childhood?"

You shrugged in defeat. "Fair enough. So, how you doing today?"

Meryl bent down to speak closer with you. "Alright. Is it ok if I go inside with you? I need to borrow something from Maggie."

You grinned slyly at her. "I don't know. That 'little' joke is still stinging a bit."

Meryl gave you the puppy dog eyes. "Oh, come on. Please, big brother sir.."

On the one hand you were enjoying playing around with your sister. Just like old times.

"I'll bring the paper in for you." Meryl folded her hands in a begging position.

But on the other hand. You were getting tired from pulling the giant paper.

"Alright. But only because I like making you do stuff for me." You said sitting on the paper and waiting for pick up.

1111.content:
On the front page the head line was titled, "Mon Cons Escape!"
"What's this?" You ask Maggie.
Your lioness wife unfolded the paper and began reading the front page aloud while Meryl sat down.
"Last night, around 3am, the monster prison Under Gloom, experienced its first break out in the facility's history. More than 60 inmates broke out of their cells and over powered the guards on duty before heading out of the underground building and onto the surface. Fortunately, the local police forces reacted quickly upon word from the prison's warden and as of now nearly all inmates have been recaptured and returned to their cells.
"However, 2 people are still unaccounted for after the breakout. Security Guard Lisa Darkholme and an as of yet unidentified male prisoner... See page 5 for more."
Maggie opened to page 5 and looked over it quickly. Once done she closed the paper and placed it on the table with a sigh.
"Not much after that, just something about a possible inside job. They're starting an internal investigation into it. Nothing about who the escaped prisoner is or any real info about him at all. It's really annoying."
Meryl piped in. "Maybe he's so dangerous they don't want anyone actively looking for him."
Maggie just shrugged. "All I know is that now I'm going to spend all day answering 911 calls now. I'll have to hunt down every strange guy from here to Europe before long."
Maggie then got a weird look on her face that slowly turned to a wicked grin. "Then again, it might give me the best chance to lock up the trouble making Banshee."
"Maggie!" Meryl cried in shock. "That is a huge abuse of your authority!"
"Calm down." Maggie said through a fit of laughter. "I was half joking."
"Which means your half serious."
"Maybe." Maggie replied innocently as she looked off into space letting the wonder images of herself leading that banshee to lock up play out in her head.
The whole time this was going on in your kitchen, you were miles away and years in the past. The story of an unknown escaped monster worried you and pulled an old memory out to the open. Something about the whole situation screamed 'DANGER' to you. As you looked at the title page again, that memory came back suddenly and you dived into it.

Dimly lit caverns marked your walk. The smell of blood and death was all around. Turning a corner you found bodies of both humans and monster, twisted and broken, laying all over the ground. Their faces told of the horror they witnessed as they unleashed their silent screams.
You passed through the door way and into the massive center room. There he stood, a man dressed in black tall and proud over his latest kill. He turned at your approach and your heart quickened. His lips are dripping red as they lift into a mocking smile, and his glowing orange eyes lock on you. He opens his mouth and laughs, a cold pitiless laugh that make the hair on your neck stand on end. You are terrified and angry at the same time. Rage over comes fear and you charge this monster with a war cry.

"Ow! Neil easy on the fur."
Maggie's sudden cry of pain snapped you back to attention. You noticed you had grabbed a hand full of the fur on Maggie's nose and pulled. You let go quickly and apologized while rubbing the spot you pulled on.
"Oh god, I'm so sorry Maggie. Are you alright?"
"Yes," Maggie said calmly. "What's wrong?"
"Sorry, it's just the idea of a monster criminal on the loose scares me a bit."
"It's alright, I understand. But what do you have to worry about? Under Gloom is miles away, and there's no reason for him to come out to these parts. You're worrying yourself over nothing sweetie."
Maggie smiled so sweetly at you, you couldn't help but return it. But you also couldn't relax, not internally. You hid your worry from Maggie and just sat silently on her nose for a while longer.
She was right of course...if this was a normal monster. But the chance of it being HIM was low. After all the trouble you and the others went through to stop him, they wouldn't just let him escape...right?
Thankfully Meryl pulled you from this unnerving thought. "So, Neil. You said you're off from work tomorrow, right? Want to come over and visit me for awhile?"

Maggie's eyes shot open when she heard those dreaded four word: "Yo Mama so Fat..."

"... that they need a pulley system just to get her out of the tub!" Maggie immediately recognizes the voice and growls. "Meagan!" she yells. "And those four awful words! Oh, that's it! This mess started when that damn fox threw that water balloon at me. This must be some kind of a curse." Before you can say anything, you slip into Maggie's squishier than usual cleavage as she waddles off angrily, tearing the doorway a new one in the process. "This won't end well." Said Meryl.

"I don't know whether to arrest you, shoot you or smother you to death with my rolls. You put a curse on me, you mutt!" Meagan gives a smirk. "Well it serves you right, you man-stealer." 1122221111111.title: Mega Maggie

11222211111111.content:
"...When she goes jogging, it measures on the Richter Scale!" Meagan yells. Maggie lets out a roar of pure anger.

"I WILL RIP YOU TO PIECES!" She bellows. At that, Meagan takes off running, with Maggie following.

The vibrations from Maggie running actually throw you out of her cleavage and up near her head. Freaked out, you manage to grab a strand of Maggies hair and hold on tight. As you do, you look around and see an awful sight: Maggie's footsteps actually are making the neighborhood shake. Trash cans are falling over, car alarms are going off, and you swore you saw cracks in the pavement from where Maggie stepped. This was getting out of hand.

Eventually, Maggie runs out of energy and has to stop. You let go of her hair and, luckily, land on her shoulder. You look at your wife and see that she's blown up again. She now looks like she'd weigh 8 tons if she were human. She was panting heavily. And Meagan was long gone.

"DO I LOOK ALRIGHT?" She yells. "I'VE BLIMPED UP AGAIN, MEAGAN GOT AWAY, AND-" Before she can finish, she hears sirens. She turns and sees Jolene and Irma pull up in Jolene's cruiser. She also sees the destruction she accidentally caused.

"Sheriff Reaver!" Jolene yells. "What happened?"

"It's a long, annoying, rage inducing story." Maggie says.

"Unfortunately yes." Maggie replies. "Since you're here, I'm afraid I'll need to take a sick leave until I can get all this..." She motions to her gargantuan body. "...sorted out. Let the mayor know, and she'll appoint a temporary replacement sheriff."

"Yes Sheriff Reaver!" The two deputies say, then they turn to leave.

"We'd better get home." Maggie says, turning her head to look at you. "Sapphire will want to know what happened."

"Maggie," You say. "Can you even move now?"

Can she?

113.content:
You hear stomping and then looked up to see a massive muscled shadow that looked somewhat canine. Well, close. It was your next door neighbor, the werehyena, Summer Macbeth, in all her naked muscle bound glory. From the look on her face she wasn't in a good mood, not that she ever was. Still she would never harm a human, so as she's picking up her own newspaper, you decide to greet her.

"Good morning Summer!" you yell up to her. Summer turns and looks down on you. "What's so good about it Neil," she replies. "Don't poke the hyena. I'm not in the mood for chatting today." You stand up your newspaper as Summer starts walking back towards her house. That was when Summer's other neighbor, Flora the spriggan pokes her head over the fence separating their yards. "Hi diddly-deena, neighborina hyena!" shouts Flora in her chipper mood. "Wonderful day we're having Macbeth."

Summer was not particularly fond of Flora nor her cheerful demeanor and looks at the fairy with disdain. "Uh-oh," says Flora. "Someone's grumpy. Come on Summer, a smile's a rainbow you wear on your face." "Shut up Flanders!" yells Summer rudely. Summer spots a large rock in her yard and you look on as she picks it up and tosses it at Flora. However, Flora catches the rock and smiles. "Why thank you Summer," she says. "This will make a fine addition to my rock garden." Summer growls and grabs her ears in frustration before she stomps into her house. "Trespassers will be shot!" shouts Summer. "Especially trespassers who are dead to me!" She slams the door so hard you're forced to cover your ears.

You hold up your newspaper that is much bigger than yourself and rub your chin. Summer seemed to be in a particularly bad mood today. You wonder if something was bugging her since she was even grouchier than she normally is. Maybe you should check up on her. She may be in a bad mood but Summer didn't harm humans. She didn't even eat meat. Then again, it's not any of your business.

But you're still curious. What do you do?
113.title: The Hyena Next Door

1131.content:
It's true that Summer was always somewhat grumpy, but she seemed extra grumpy today and you decide it would probably be a good idea to check up on her. As the giant were hyena stomps in the front door, you slid under her fence and then run up and duck underneath her door.

As you do, you yell out and move to the side as the hyena titaness nearly steps on you. Summer then looks down and realizes you're there. "Dang it, Neil," she says grumpily. "I could've stepped on you. Don't you think you should go home now? Maggie will be worried if you don't come back soon." "I'm worried about you," you say. "You're acting grouchy, even for you."

Summer then lets out a sigh. "Fine," she says. "It's my sister." "Your sister?" you ask. You heard about Summer's older sister. Her name was Cree and she lived in Fearfield. You thought that their names were kind of funny since the names were Cree and Summer, like that actress. Ironic given their species as hyena based monsters. From what you heard Cree was the last monster you'd want to meet. She was a psychotic creature who put Meagan to shame. Maggie said that Cree worked in a prison and her job was to beat up any prisoner that acted up. A job she enjoyed way too much.

You turn your head to a photograph of Summer and her sister. From the looks of it, Cree was the same height as Summer but had deep brown fur and red hair worn with large Tomboyish sideburns. Also, in contrast to Summer's muscular amazonian figure, Cree was almost as fat as Maggie was.

That's when Summer explains. "Cree is gonna be in town for a few days because of our parents' anniversary." "That doesn't sound too bad." You say. "Oh yeah?!" snapped Summer. "She's bringing Aurelia!" You then see the problem. Aurelia was Summer's sister-in-law and Cree's wife. You don't know what she looks like but you heard that she was a were jackal. For some reason, Summer just plain hated Aurelia and has been mad at Cree for a decade for marrying the jackal woman. In fact, Summer's hatred of Aurelia dwarfed her hatred of Flora.

You have no idea why. Perhaps Summer didn't approve of same sex marriage and her behavior was due to homophobia. Or perhaps Summer's dislike from Aurelia came from racism. Some species of monsters don't like other species; vampires and werewolves didn't always get along, gryphons had an aversion to pegasi and unicorns and frost giants and dark elves apparently don't get along since you heard Irma once make a condescending remark about dark elves.

Summer growls just thinking about Aurelia and grits her teeth as you step back and she punches the wall. "Why did Cree have to marry that one-eyed bitch!" "Whoa! That's a strong word for you to say given your..." "I'm not a dog, Neil," says Summer. "I can see the confusion but hyenas aren't really canines. That's beside the point. I do not want that Anubial bone muncher in my house! And I suggest you go home if you know what's good for you. I'm a vegetarian but Cree and Aurelia, they'd eat you alive in a heartbeat."

Suddenly there's a knock at the door and you hide under the couch as Summer walks to open it. But who is at the door when Summer opens it?

1151.content:
The shadow appears but there's no sound to go with it. Usually when a monster's approaching you hear rumbling. You look up and see a ghost woman floating towards you. Its Raven, the banshee. She's got a voluptuous body and green hair with pink purple and blue highlights. She's wearing a Victorian ballroom dress and you never really see her feet because she floats everywhere. The floating is the reason you didn't hear her coming. You think about dropping the paper and hiding but her eyes lock with yours and you know she's seen you.

"Hello Neil!" she says brightly as she floats closer to you. "Hi Raven." you say with a sigh. She bends down and puts her face close to you, the suddenness of it making you jump back. "Having a good morning?" she asks while batting her eyes. As usual she's starting to flirt with you. You'll admit she's very attractive, but you're married. You've tried to explain this to her but she just won't accept it and thinks she can steal you from your wife. "Its going okay I guess. Just getting the paper." you answer. "Well how about instead the two of us have a little morning walk?" she asks. She walks her fingers over to you as she says this. Even though its just her hand you have to look up at it. "No thanks." you reply and keep dragging your paper.

Suddenly you fall over as the paper is snatched away. You look to see that Raven is holding the paper with her arms crossed. "I guess you can't get the paper now." she says innocently. "Come on Raven." you say annoyed. The banshee does a twirl in the air and smiles. "Come on? Where are we going?" she asks slyly. Giving up you head to your door to get away from her. Unfortunately Raven's not ready for you to go and flies in front of you. "Ah ah ah..." she says as she snatches you up. "We should get going." She gives you a smooch as you struggle in her grip. She begins to float away with you in hand, whistling happily as she goes.

As the shadow comes closer, you see that it's heavy and feline shaped, similar to Maggie, except that the neck looked like that of a snake. You look and see that jogging down the street and creating small earthquakes in the process was none other than the town recluse, Isis. Isis was a monster known as a serpopard, an Egyptian monster resembling a leopard with a serpentine neck. What does Isis do?

11521.content:
After a few seconds, the serpopard woman just dips her head politely as a greeting and continues on her way, making a few earthquakes as she goes. You on the other hand were still confused, was she a mute? Or just didn't like talking? You had heard that she was very introverted, just not like that. Well, regardless, you are at least glad she didn't eat you... or worse. Shrugging, you proceed to drag the newspaper back inside. After crossing the hallway, you hear a commotion, Maggie was probably on the phone, agitated. You were about to go ask her what happened when a wide blur just dashed past you towards the door. As you stood there, mouth agape and hand raised, stupefied, your daughter peeks from the kitchen, looking surprised herself. "W-wuh... what was that all about?" you asked the teenage mer-lion as she came into full view.

"Dad? I think Mom is going to be very busy today. Something about a serious situation down at the precinct. She said it was very important." Sapphire walked to you and picked you up, gently. The look on her face was that of worry. "Is she going to be okay?" Rubbing her finger soothingly, you give her a smile, putting her at ease.

"Don't worry, hun, I'm sure Maggie can handle it, she's a nemean lion, she'll be alright." putting on a mocking yet stern face, you put your hands on your hips and look at the titanic teen. "Now then, isn't it time for you to head on to school?

"Aw, but Da~ad! I woke up early! At least let me finish my breakfast!" and with that, the two of you chuckled and walked back to the table, so she could finish her sizeable meal and you could have yourself your morning cofee.


The rest of the day passed as a blur, you accompanied Sapphire to school, dropped her off, took a cab to your job, since Maggie took the car with her, and managed to get there on time for your shift. Atlanta gave you some minor trouble as usual, something about the television at the salon not working and you having to go inside it to see what was up. Fortunately, Prima had to step in before something bad would happen to you, the last thing she wanted was for her only decent employee to get fried by a short circuit. For your credit, though, you managed to do everything they asked, and got out of it relatively unharmed, so no problems there.

Nothing, however, could prepare you to what was coming in the evening.


After you made it back, in the early evening, you arrive to find Sapphire waiting for you, she always arrived first, and normally she would've entered the house by now. Odd, she seemed worried. Seeing you arrive lifted her spirits, and she walked up to you and picked you up, rubbing your tiny self against her fuzzy cheek. "Hey kiddo, how was your day?"

"Dad, did you hear the news?" when you shook your head in the negative, and explained that the TV at the salon was busted, Sapphire got even more worried. "They announced it at school, some government agents went there, something about an 'outbreak' at the precinct!" she was getting too anxious, so you did what you could to calm her down.

"Woah, easy, girl. Deep breaths. Okay now, what's this about an outbreak at the precinct?" you ask, your tone serious. Taking a few breaths to calm herself, your giant daughter explains the situation.

"They interrupted the classes to tell us there was an outbreak at Mom's workplace and they had to take precautionary measures. They also brought some medics and nurses to the school, all male for some reason, and had us inoculated with some antivirus or something." as she finished and let you ponder the news, she sheepishly asked "...Dad, is Mom going to be okay?" Giving her a reassuring half-smile, you gesture indoors, and the two of you proceed inside.

After setting down her backpack and sitting on the large sofa, she places you in her shoulder and you rub her neck. "Honey, I've told you, didn't I? Your mother is tough, she can handle herself pretty well when she's in a pickle. That is not to say I'm not worried about her, I am, believe me, all I'm asking is for you to have some faith in her. She's the town's Sheriff, remember? Here, let me tell you something that happened a while back, when she first began working there, she-"

The sound of a car parking in front of the house forced you to stop your story short (you were just about to start it, too), and both you and your daughter turned your heads to the door. There were muffled voices outside, two of them, feminine, but slightly deep. Sapphire looks at you perched up in her shoulder, tense. "Is that Mom?"

Loud, heavy steps filled the hallway as the door opened, and in walked your wife and a weretigress you recognized as Prussia, the town's Marshall. Your wife huffed and panted, as well as Prussia, as she noticed you and your daughter. "Hi Neil. Busy and awful day, you wouldn't believe it." Seeing your shocked faces made the town Marshall chuckle, whereas your wife only sighed. "Just let me sit down, I can explain all of this..."

Except, 'all of this' was referring to how huge the two adult felines have gotten. Maggie plopped herself down on another couch, her unitard barely holding together, as her bulk had increased exponentially, her gargantuan belly covering her whole lap with flab, her massive thighs and butt spreading out like butter on the double seats, and her huge cleavage poking out from the leotard, having gone a few cup sizes. Her arms were now pillowy and even her fingers had become poofier. Her double chin, which gave her a round, but lovely face, had swelled even more, and you could notice another chin forming under her second chin.

Prussia merely leaned against the wall, groaning as she tried to cross her arms over her titanic bosom, her predicament the same as your wife, except she had a lot more in the chest department than Maggie, her cowgirl outfit full of visible tears and openings. You could've also sworn she was slightly taller, and by extension, Maggie as well.

A shocked silence filled the living room, but Sapphire gradually worked up the courage to ask the question that was boiling in your head. "M-Mom? What ha-happened to you and Ms.Kipling?" Maggie gave you both a reassuring smile, and patted her sizeable dome of a stomach.

"Honey... Dear... there was an outbreak of nebutori at the precinct. Someone was caught by Prussia here smuggling illegal items, and while she was... 'distracted'..." she glared at the weretigress, who in turn began whistling a made up tune, looking away." the crook managed to slip a vial of that junk into her shell. After they escorted her to her cell to deal with the proceedings and called me, she made a makeshift smoke bomb with some more tools she had slipped past the inspection. When I arrived and they were about to take her in for questioning, she blew the damn thing up, and escaped. She is now at large."

"And we... we're stuck like this, large. The whole precinct, plus some more folks who were there, were affected. I still can't quite get how that no good, dirty, sneaky excuse of a kappa managed to escape without even suffering the effects of this crap!" Prussia growled in a low voice. Her voice roused you from your shocked stupor, and you turned to her.

"Wait, why are you here as well, Prussia?" She was about to retort something snarky, but Maggie cut in quickly.

"Had a little... accident with the car, Neil. It's currently undergoing repairs. I... ugh, I kinda grew when I entered the car to give that kappa chase. Prussia was kind enough to offer a ride back here, since I can't walk that far without having to catch my breath, and her car is roomier and sturdier than ours. And now she is about to leave, aren't you?" once again, she gave the striped feline an frigid glare, to which the obese Marshall mumbled a low 'yeah'. Without even turning to look at you three, she muttered a goodnight and left, surprisingly not slamming the door on the way out.

Sapphire got up, walked towards Maggie and set you down on her (now flabbier) shoulder. You began rubbing her fur, and she purred at your contact. "It's gonna be okay, dear. Sapphire and I were worried sick when we heard the news, but at least you're safe and sound." the young mer-lion nodded. Maggie kept purring, until suddenly her eyes shot open, and she stared at Sapphire, panic practically written all over her face.

"No! No no, Sapphire, I just remembered, you have to get away from me, nebutori is highly contagious!" her outburst startled you and your daughter, surprisingly affecting you more than the youth herself. With a shrug, she rolled up the sleeve of her left arm to show a spot with a bandaid on.

"Mom, I was inoculated at school. I don't think I'm going to be infected anytime soon. I don't think it will last forever, but the school is taking precautions to prevent this from spreading. Or so we were told." at this, you remembered what Sapphire told you earlier. Maggie calmed down after hearing this, but was still agitated. "It's been a long day, Mom, Dad. I think we all need to get some rest, this is just too much to take in."

"Sapphire's right, hun, a hectic day deserves a nice meal. Although..." you eye her adipose-filled belly before continuing. "...we might have to make a larger portion this time." Maggie just grunts in annoyance, and you playfully rub her shoulder with your hands.

With your touch calming her down, and Sapphire starting to set the table for dinner, your bloated wife just sighed. "...this is going to take a lot of getting used to..."

You remember Sapphire as only being 100ft shorter than Maggie, but from your position Maggie looked like she was twice as tall as Sapphire. Whoever it is, it's like they can walk straight through walls." Maggie turns to Sapphire and asks "How was your day sweetie?" But when Sapphire opens her mouth to speak, all that comes out is the sound of a rooster crowing. Needless to say, this really confused you. "What was that?" What was even stranger, was that Maggie reacted as if nothing weird was going on. She just said "That's nice, dear." Before returning to her meal. "Maggie, did you just hear what came out of our daughter's mouth?"

"Of course. She said she aced her math test this morning. Why?"

"But I could have sworn..."

Suddenly, there's a loud popping noise, and where your wife was sitting, there is now a gigantic flamingo. You rub your eyes, only to see that you're not hallucinating. You turn around to see that your daughter is now a blue kangaroo.

"What's going on around here!?"

Suddenly, you here a high pitched laugh, and a female voice says "Confusing, isn't it?" You turn to see what appeared to be a human woman, dressed in a black and purple jester costume, her face colored white with black lipstick and eyeliner. "Who are you? Did you do this?" You ask angrily

The jester woman grins. "What's wrong? You don't like my work?" She levitate a few inches off the surface of the table, and begins flying around you in circles. "What are you?" You ask "You're my size, so you can't be a monster."

"Oh, there are many who would disagree on that. I can be any size I want, do anything I want, and what I want right now is to have some fun."

"Just who are you, exactly?"

"I'm your worst nightmare. But just call me Kltpzyxm."

"Call you what?"

She sighs in frustration, and pronounces it slowly. "Kill-tip-see-zim" "Well, where did you come from, and why did you do this to my family?" She smiles and shrugs "I came from the tenth dimension, and I did this out of boredom mostly.I hate boring, and nothing amuses me more than screwing with the minds of three dimensional beings."

Now you were getting mad. She did this just for entertainment? That's got to be the dumbest thing you've ever heard. "You grab her by the collar and lift her up off the table.

"Change them back now!"

You soon realize your mistake, as the next thing you know, you're the one being held, hundreds of feet in the air as a now giant Kltpzyxm is squeezing her first around you.

"Nuh uh uh, you shouldn't threaten a lady, especially one with god-like powers. Tell you what, let's play a game."

If it meant getting rid of this inter-dimensional Harley Quinn knock off, you'd try anything. "Fine. What's your game?" "If you get me to say my name backwards, I'll disappear, for say, a week or so. But if you don't get me to say it within an hour, you and your family become my playthings." It suddenly occurs to you that this scenario seems familiar. Didn't you see this in a Superman cartoon before? An idea forms in your head, and you inwardly smile to yourself.

"So, what do I have to do to get you to go away again?"

"Get me to say my name backwards."

"How can I say it backwards if I can't even say it forwards?"

"No! I have to say it!"

"Say what?"

"Mxyzptlk!"

POOF!

Suddenly, you're sitting on your dining room table, eating dinner, with your wife and daughter back to normal. "Dear, did something just happen?" Maggie asks. You smile. "No, nothing. What's for dessert?"
131.title: Kltpzyxm

1311.content:
A week later, you're riding to work with your skeleton sister Meryl. Maggie had to go into work earlier than usual because of a Specter related emergency so Meryl offered you a ride. Of course, being late for work doesn't concern you because you have Kltpzyxm to worry about. She said she'd be back. So, you decided to be ready.

As your sister was driving, you walked alongside the front window and took out a marker to draw big letters on the front. Meryl notices this just as you've managed to write the Z and needless to say, she isn't happy. "Hey!" yells the giant skeleton. "What's the big idea Neil!? I offer you a ride and you mess up my car?" "Don't worry Meryl," you say. "It's only temporary." "What are you writing anyway?" "Mxyzptlk." Meryl looks at you as if you're crazy but still keeps an eye on the road. "Mxyzptlk? You mean that annoying little imp who's always pestering Superman?"

You nod your head. "Well, just last week, I had trouble with a real life version from Dimension 10." "You're kidding." "No, she said her name was Kltpzyxm." "Mxyzptlk? Kltpzyxm? You've been hanging around Lily too much. No offense Neil, but your wife has crazy friends." You finish drawing the M on the windshield before responding. "You're the one who introduced me to Maggie, remember bonehead?" "Touché."

Suddenly, as Meryl is driving, a stop sign appears out of nowhere and forces your sister to slam on the brakes. You yell and slide across the dashboard as one of Meryl's eyes roll out of her skull. Meryl winds up skidding off the road before her tires mysteriously turn into peppermint.

"Where did that stop sign come from?!" yells Meryl as she puts her eye back into her head. Meryl gets out and sees her now candied tires melting on the ground. "Huh?" Suddenly there's a thundering sound and a gust of smoke and before you know it, your sister has been turned into a giant skeleton of a brontosaurus. "What the Sam Hill!?" "Yep," you say as you look at your watch. "That should be her."

There's another puff of smoke and Kltpzyxm shows up waving in your face. "Guess who." She says. "Oh," you say. "Hello Ms. Mxyzptlk." "It's Kltpzyxm not Mxy... Oh I see what you're trying to do. You must think I'm stupid." Meryl lowers her head and spots you and Kltpzyxm. "Who's this clown Neil?" she asks. Kltpzyxm smiles maliciously and snaps her fingers to make Meryl explode in a puff of smoke before revealing your sister had turned into a skeleton of a gargoyle. As Meryl is trying to wrap her skull around this, Kltpzyxm snaps her fingers and turns your sister into a skeleton of a donkey and then a skeleton of a frog and then a skeleton of a hippopotamus.

"Skeletons are hilarious," says Kltpzyxm. "Why didn't you tell me your sister was undead." Meryl grits her now enlarged tooth bones because she isn't amused. "This crap ain't funny. Change me back right now or else..." Kltpzyxm then snaps her fingers and turns Meryl into a skeletal elephant before laughing like a hyena. "You're despicable!" yells Meryl. Kltpzyxm laughs but then decides to spring the trap.

"Yeah, real funny Kltpzyxm. But we can't stay, we have to get to the car wash. Some vandals defaced my sister's Scaravan." "It doesn't look that bad to me," says Kltpzyxm. "Hey, what's this word?" Kltpzyxm snaps her fingers to summon a magnifying glass to look at the word you wrote. Upon realizing what she read, Kltpzyxm gasps and you give a sneer.

"BOOM!"

Kltpzyxm disappears in a flash of light and Meryl is turned back to her normal form (Well normal for a 650ft skeleton). "I told you so." You say. Meryl let out a mumble before stepping back into her car. "I should've stayed in the ground." You let out a sigh as Meryl starts the car again. "Get used to it Little Sis," you say. "She'll be back in seven days." "Seven days or not, you're cleaning my windshield."

Where are you when Kltpzyxm attacks you again the next week?
1311.title: Kltpzyxm Returns

13111.content:
The next week, you're busy at work, giving the succubus giantess Lee a manicure. However, you knew you were expecting bad company so you figured you'd paint a little message on the fingernails. The succubus night singer looks down in confusion. "What are you doing human?" she asks. "I didn't request that paint job." "Oh this," you say as you finish painting a P on Lee's thumbnail. "It's, uh, the latest thing." Lee takes a closer look and reads the message, since the succubus used to be a human, she recognized the letters slightly. "Mxyzp... oh, I remember that guy. Not by much though. I never was much of a comic fan. Don't paint that on my pinkies though, I want them red for a little contrast." "Yes ma'am," you say. "And one.. two..."

There's a puff of smoke and Kltpzyxm appears again. You let out a sigh. "Don't you have anything better to do?" you ask. "Uh-uh," says Kltpzyxm with a smirk. "You denied me my fun last time, but this time..." "This time I'm at work and as you can see I'm working on a succubus, you know how nasty they can get when you don't pay attention to them. There, done Lee." Lee smiles and then holds up her nail. "You've just got to try out this nail job. This little guy is the best in the business." Kltpzyxm lowers her head to get a closer look at Lee's nails before she reads the letters inscribed on them. Once she realizes what they spell, her eyes pop and she glares at you. "I hate you so much right now!" With that, Kltpzyxm vanishes in a puff of smoke. Lee lets out a scoff. "Jealous," she says. "Simply jealous."

The succubus holds up her foot and you see her massive hoof in front of you. "Don't forget the pedicure Neil. Try to make it flash." "And while you're at it," says Prima. "If that friend of yours comes back, tell her about the sign." The mammoth giantess points to a "no-smoking" sign as you work on Lee's massive hoof.

One week later, you're already waiting for Kltpzyxm to appear and start the process over again. At that moment you're visiting with your sister Meryl and playing a game of chess with Flint, your golem brother in law. As you push one of your pawns forward, Flint notices you're troubled. "Something bothering you Neil?" your brother-in-law asks. "You might say that Flint," you say. "I'm expecting company and not looking forward to it. And no, it's not Cattleya. This time." Flint moves his bishop to take your pawn and then rubs his chin. "Worse than Cattlya? How is that even possible."

You move a knight forward and stop to catch your breath. "Well, I don't know if Meryl already told you but back on Earth we have comic books involving heroes and villains. You must have heard of Superman right? Well, he has an enemy called Mr. Mxyzptlk." Flint raises an eye slab at that before moving a pawn forward. "That's a funny name." "There's nothing funny about him," you say. "He's an annoying trickster that can warp reality. The only way to get rid of him is to get him to say his name backwards, Kltpzyxm." Flint actually lets out a laugh at that as his stone body makes noises.

"Don't laugh. I recently ran into someone just like Mxyzptlk named Kltpzyxm. Meryl ran into her too." Meryl comes forward and places drinks on the table. A glass for Flint and a thimble for you. "Believe me dear," says Meryl to Flint. "That babe is dangerous and she's gonna be on the warpath now that Neil's outsmarted her thrice. Does Maggie know about this?" You just take a drink. "She'd probably think I was crazy if I told her. I'm worried. Kltpzyxm should've been here by now." "Maybe she gave up." Says Flint. You shake your head. "No," you say. "If she's anything like Mxyzptlk. I doubt it."

At that time, Kltpzyxm was flying overhead and was in a sour mood. "I can't believe it. He fooled me three times. I'm not gonna take this anymore! Maybe I better change tactics. There has got to be somebody in this town who hates this punk as much as I do.

As Kltpzyxm flies over your house, she looks across the street to the home of Meagan the were fox, your ex-girlfriend. Inside there are photographs on the wall of you that have knives jabbed into them and Meagan appeared to be chewing on an effigy of you. Twenty-years and she still has a grudge. "Hmm," says Kltpzyxm. "Interesting. But I wonder." Kltpzyxm then proceeds to fly downtown above your mother-in-law Cattleya's house. Inside Cattleya was washing dishes but Kltpzyxm saw inside that there was a photograph of you on a dartboard. "Interesting," says Kltpzyxm. "It seems that there are two hotheads who sound like fun. Maybe we can team up against Neil, or maybe they could be good for a laugh."

Who does Kltpzyxm decide to visit?
13111.title: Changing Tactics

choices: Kltpzyxm's Plan - Trick Maggie into Eating You
Cattleya's Plan - Frame You for Cheating
131112.content:
"Hmmm," says Kltpzyxm. "Maybe that fat cat would be fun." Kltpzyxm snaps her fingers as she prepares to formally meet Cattleya. That rotten mother-in-law of yours continues to wash dishes when she notices pink bubbles forming out of the drain and grunts. The splinter cat giantess leaves the kitchen and returns with a plunger to tackle the problem only for Kltpzyxm to emerge from the drain smiling, prompting Cattleya to scream and grab a frying pan to assault Kltpzyxm with.

Kltpzyxm rubs her head as Cattleya growls at her. "That's a very easy way to give someone a heart attack!" yells your mother-in-law. "Easy Lady," says Kltpzyxm. "Ouch. By the way, you might want to look at the water heater." "I'm calling the police," says Kltpzyxm as she walks to the phone. "I'll have you know my daughter is the sheriff. She knows how to deal with weirdoes like..." Before Cattleya can even grab the phone, Kltpzyxm snaps her fingers and the phone winds up attacked to the ceiling. Cattleya turns her head and Kltpzyxm smiles. "Wow. So you're the guy's mother-in-law. Everyone has in-laws they hate."

Cattleya suddenly is very interested. "How do you know that little cockroach." Kltpzyxm lets out a scoff. "That wet blanket has ruined my fun three times already. By the way, I'm Kltpzyxm." Cattleya lets out a hiss. "Don't get me started. I thought I raised my Maggie not to fall in love with insects. Humans are only good for three things; breakfast, lunch and dinner. Fang was definitely no prize as far as son-in-laws go but at least he was a monster. And Neil's job. I'll bet he only goes there so he can flirt with other monsters. The only thing he has working for him is Sapphire." Kltpzyxm snaps her fingers again and it isn't long before she and your mother-in-law are talking over tea.

"You really hate him, don't you?" asks Kltpzyxm. "Hate him enough to do something about it?" Cattleya lets out a purr as she gives an evil smirk. "I'd like nothing better than to get rid of that pest forever. If Neil wasn't my son-in-law, I'd swallow him with a swig of rum. Perhaps the two of us could take that microbe down a few pegs." Kltpzyxm makes a literal lightbulb appear over her head. "I have an idea," she says. "I'm very good at warping reality. Perhaps I could find a way to hit him where it hurts the most." "Go on," says Cattleya. "Go on."

Kltpzyxm lets out a giggle. "Your Maggie doesn't have much of a taste for humans does she?" "I wish," says Cattleya. "Even before she started dating the loser, she considered humans to be quote un-quote, 'sometimes food'. Fiona may not eat humans now, but she had a good appetite." "Well," says Kltpzyxm with a giggle. "How about we remind Maggie that she married a man lower than her in the food chain. If I can somehow manage to trick your daughter into going black widow, it will be munch, munch, sayonara sucker!" Cattleya purrs at that plan but rubs her chin.

"It's a good plan, but we have to ensure he won't be missed. We have to make Maggie hate Neil somehow. If you can make it look like Neil was cheating on Maggie, she'd go ballistic. Perhaps maybe make it look like he's seeing multiple girls on the side." Cattleya stops to laugh as she drinks some tea. "Maggie would be so mad, she'd kick him out if she doesn't squash him like the bug he is first."

Kltpzyxm and Cattleya laugh wickedly at their two plans. "The only question," says Kltpzyxm. "Is which diabolical plan do we do?"
131112.title: Cattleya and Kltpzyxm

132.content:
As you're waiting for your assignment Prima pulls her trunk upwards and you look up at your elephantine boss's enormous eye. "Well Neil, since you're so good at working on monsters' hands and feet, I think you'll be on nail duty again."

You gotta admit, manicures and pedicures were your specialty so this worked out as Prima led you to your work station. It took some getting used to though because not all monsters had the same toenails as humans. But you thanked your lucky star that most monsters don't wear shoes so the sweaty foot odor is limited. The main reason you got the job was for your nail skills.

As Prima lays you down, you pick up a paintbrush used for the nail polish and twirl it around. "You don't have to worry Prima," you say. "When it comes to nails, I cannot fail." Prima rolls her eyes and twirls her trunk slightly. "Just get ready before the customers show up, please."

You shrug your shoulders. Prima is the one who needs to relax. You wonder who the first customer of the day will be?
132.title: Mani-Pediz

choices: Moxie Appears to Have Motion Sickness (Uh-oh)
Moxie is in a Particularly Bad Mood Today
1321.content:
"Come to think about it," says Prima. "Moxie said she'd be here first thing today. Auto repair is murder on fingernails." "I see." You say. "Is something wrong Neil?" asks Prima in concern. "No Prima," you say. "Everything's fine." "That's good," says your elephantine boss. "If you need me, I'll be tending to the customers in the spa baths." You nod your head and then start to shiver.

As you polish a file the size of a surfboard, you shake your head. Moxie was a gremlin who was abnormally tall for her species. Most gremlins don't get any bigger than 300ft but Moxie was a tall glass of water to say the least. Being a gremlin, she was the town mechanic.

However, you don't trust her. Moxie doesn't know it but you learned she was having an affair with Lily's husband Angus. You were appalled that it didn't bother Moxie at all that she was dating a married man. Shameless tramp. Of course, you decided to keep it to yourself. Maggie would no doubt tell Lily if you told her. Minotaurs were by nature temperamental and Lily wasn't a model of mental stability to begin with. You didn't want to add more fuel to the fire so to speak.

You figured you wouldn't rat on Angus and Moxie until something happened to really concern you. Suddenly you hear the bell above the door ring and turn to see Moxie coming in for a nail job.
1321.title: Gremlins and Homewreckers

13212.content:
You look forward and gasp. Moxie is staggering in and holding her head as if she has motion sickness. However, that's not what concerns you. Moxie has a big bulging pregnant belly and there are no guesses as to who the father is. "Oh no." You say mentally. Moxie staggers forward and Atlanta takes a good look at the big belly. "Moxie," she says. "You're pregnant? When did this happen?" Moxie shrugs her shoulders. "Just two months ago." "Two months?" asked Prima. "And already that big? Kinda large for a baby gremlin."

Moxie laughs nervously but you just glare. She didn't know you were onto her but you were still pretty mad that she let that happen. There was no doubt Angus was the father. You didn't think the affair would go that far. This was so not good. If Lily found out about this. It would not end well at all. "So," says Atlanta. "Who's the father?" Moxie gives a nervous look and turns the other way to avoid telling the truth before she sits down and holds her big yellow nails in front of you. You start to file Moxie's enormous fingernails, occasionally looking up and glaring at her and then looking down at her big pregnant belly. What do you do now? Lily would most likely find out sooner or later. A gremlin born with horns and hooves would attract a lot of attention.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

After work that night, you're getting off of work and Maggie picks you up and sticks you between her breasts. "So how was work today?" you ask. You hold your head down to Maggie's confusion. You want to tell Maggie. After all, Lily was Maggie's friend. But you don't know whether or not you should. You've kept the affair to yourself all these years because you were afraid Maggie would tell Lily and there's no telling what that crazy heifer would do if she found out her husband has been cheating on her for so long.

At dinnertime, you're so single-minded on Moxie's pregnancy that you can't even eat. Sapphire and Maggie look at you in concern. "Something bugging you Dear?" asks Maggie. "You haven't even touched your centipede fettuccine." You definitely didn't want to say anything with Sapphire in the room but the secret was eating you up inside. Now was the big moment, should you pull the bandage off and tell Maggie what was going on or should you keep what's going on between Angus and Moxie a secret until you can't keep it any longer?
13212.title: Red Flag, Take Warning

choices: Lily, and She's Fuming Mad (Maggie Told Her)
132121.content:
You figure you couldn't keep the secret away from your wife forever and lower your head. "Sapphire," you say. "Would you mind leaving the room for a fe minutes." Sapphire looks at you in confusion but you gesture for her to exit the room and she complies. You don't want her to hear what you're about to discuss with Maggie.

"Maggie," you say. "There's something I should've told you sooner. Today, Moxie came into the salon." "Neil," says Maggie. "She shows up once a week at the salon. She's a mechanic. It wreaks havoc on her nails. I wouldn't exactly call that unusual." "You don't understand Maggie." You then gesture to Maggie to pick you up and then you whisper what happened in your ear. Maggie's eye immediately goes wide before she shouts "WHAAAAAAAAAT!" prompting Sapphire in the next room to plug her ears. "That bastard! Not the child, I mean Angus! Neil, why didn't you say something about this earlier?! I can't believe it. First Fang and now this!" Maggie is shocked and appalled to hear the news between the Oxnards and from the look on her face, she was ready to kill.

"Maggie," you say. "Please, calm down. This is why I didn't want to tell anyone." Maggie thinks about that and realizes something. "If word gets out, it'll kill Lily. What to do, what to do?" That night in bed, both you and Maggie were wide awake with you in between your wife's boobs as you're both trying to think of a solution to this problem. The very next day is your day off and you're nervously sitting on the coffee table as Maggie is getting dressed for work. "Don't worry, Neil," she says. "I have a plan. I'll get everyone I can together to try and figure out how to tackle this problem. You just stay here and watch Shocker's Tales and I'll be back tonight." You nod your head. "I hope you know what you're doing, Maggie." As Maggie is out the door, you see the Shocker appear laughing on the television and then immediately change the channel. "Not in the mood for Shocker's Tales today. Most of those stories are about adultery. I can't enjoy them today." You're visibly shaken. "And I can't even get to the fridge to grab a soda to calm my nerves."

That night, you're standing on Maggie's shoulders as she is forcing Sapphire out of the house so she wouldn't overhear the meeting. "I don't care what you do," says Maggie. "Go to a movie, hang out with Ruby or go to the library. Whatever. I need you out of the house tonight." "Why?" asks Sapphire. "And why were you screaming last night? What's going on?" "That's none of your business, young lady," you tell Sapphire. "For your own sake we need you out of the house until bedtime. Just go!" Sapphire shrugs her shoulders and runs off. "Why can't she go out on the town without question like other teenagers?" you ask.

That night Maggie invited many of the monsters you knew to a meeting to discuss the plan. First was your sister, Meryl and brother-in-law, Flint. Maggie had also, against all logic, invited her sister, Fiona, though you're glad Cattleya wasn't with her. Barbara Anne and Penny being Lily's closest friends besides Maggie were there as well as Pearl's parents, Fortuna and David Sirtis. Irma and Jolene were there as well as Taleela Khamen, Sapphire's history teacher and she came with the art teacher, Colleen. For some reason, Isis was there as well, but she appeared to be sleeping and it looked like she drew on her eyelids to fool Maggie. The last to arrive were your neighbors Summer MacBeth the Werehyena and Flora Flanders the Spriggan. Flora appeared to be carrying a container of potato salad.

"I wonder why Maggie wanted us all to meet here?" asks Barbara Anne. Penny just shrugs her flippers and lets out a muffled "I dunno". "Maybe it's a potluck," says Flora. "I hope so. I brought potato salad." "Shut up, Flanders." Mutters Summer. Maggie walks into the center of the room with you on her shoulder. "Everyone," says Maggie. "Neil has brought to my attention a serious emergency." Everyone, except for Flora looks on in worry. "Is there an escaped terrorist loose in Dreadberry?" asks Jolene as she takes out a pair of handcuffs with an excited look on her face. Irma looks on at Jolene as if to question why she brought handcuffs in the first place. "No, Jolene," says Maggie with a sigh. "There isn't an escaped terrorist." Jolene is about to speak again but Maggie cuts her off. "There isn't an escaped arsonist either."

"Well cut to the chase, Mags," says Barbara Anne. "What's the sitch?" "It's Moxie," says Maggie. "She's pregnant." "That's great," says Flora. "Has she thought of a name yet? Are we planning a baby shower?" "Shut up Flanders." Groans Summer. "Wait," says Fortuna. "How is that possible? Moxie isn't even married." "Who got her pregnant?" asks David. You twitch your fingers before coming clean. "Angus." Everyone is shocked and Meryl even drops her jaw into Flint's glass of beer before Flint quickly fishes it out to reattach it. "What?!" yells Meryl. Fiona looks the most upset and appears to be on the verge of tears herself, though given that she caught Fang cheating on her before the divorce, that was understandable.

Barbara Anne in response gave an angry growl. "That bastard!" "I thought it was kind of weird that the Oxnards' car kept breaking down every week." Said Fortuna as she angrily showed her fangs. "It would explain why the backseat looks like a Jackson Pollock." Says Penny. "Neil," says Taleela. "How long exactly has this been going on?" "I don't know for sure," you reply. "I only found out last year but even then it looked like they've been together a while." Colleen gives an angry growl as she scratches the side of the couch. "You mean to tell me, that bull has been cheating on his wife for freakin' years!?" Flint angrily breaks his glass in his hand. "And to think that's the guy me and the guys go fishing. I have half a mind to tear off his horns and shove them up his nose." "That goes double for me," says David as his eyes glow bright white. "What exactly does 19 years of marriage mean to him anyway!?" David punches the coffee table so hard it breaks in half, to Maggie's dismay. "Can't you take your angry out on something other than my furniture?!"

"Damn the furniture!" shouts a voice. It was Fiona to everyone's surprise and she was practically ready to have a mental breakdown. "What Angus did was a terrible sin." "That green crybaby is making sense for once," says Barbara. "We oughta run him and his secret family out of town." Jolene stood up and swung her handcuffs. "I say we lock him and Moxie up." "Jolene," says Irma. "Adultery isn't illegal. It's wrong but it's not a crime. We can't arrest them." "Killjoy!" yells Jolene in Irma's face.

"Oh my Greg Weisman," says Fortuna. "Something just occurred to me. It only takes a gremlin a few months for gestation. When the child..." "Children." Says David. "Excuse me?" asks Fortuna. "Think about it, Fortuna," says David. "Gremlins come from big families. There might be more than one baby." "Oh," says Flora. "That's even better. I hope it's twins." This time Summer holds her claws dangerously close to Flora's face. "Shut up Flanders!" "Sooner or later," says Penny. "Lily will find out and then she'll turn Angus into a steer."

"Sooner?!" yells Meryl. "The longer it goes on, the more pissed off Lily will be when the cat's out of the bag." "Excuse me?" asks Barbara Anne, slightly offended at that remark. "That's a bad idea, Meryl," says David. "That would be putting extra stress on an already unstable structure." "It's best we tell her now," says Fiona sadly. "Lest she find out for herself like I did." "I agree," says Colleen. "Fiona's a regular mess." Fiona lowers her head in sadness just as Isis wakes up and lets out a yawn.

"Should we tell her?" asks Penny. "Or shouldn't we? This is Lily we're talking about. Whoever tells her has to be somebody she'll listen to." "Looks like that means Maggie." Says Taleela. You and Maggie both look in surprise as the mummy woman rises. "After all, Maggie. You're the sheriff and her friend. You should break the news to her. Everyone else (except Isis) is in agreement and speaking amongst themselves as you look up and see Maggie biting her lip. "This can't possibly end well." You say.

The next day, you're at the salon being overseen by Prima and Atlanta as you're giving a massage to an overweight frilled werelizard woman and unintentionally causing her pain as you're so stressed out. You don't know how it could get worse when in walks...
132121.title: Minotaurs and Gremlins

1321211.content:
You growled slightly as you saw the pregnant gremlin walk in. She was all smiles. It made you even angrier. From the looks of it, she had grown since yesterday. She walked up to Atlanta.

"Morning!" She said in a cheerful voice.

"You're looking much happier today. What's up?" Atlanta asks.

"Well, I just got a call from the doctor. He just found out how many babies I'm having." She replied.

"Really? How many?" Asked Prima.

Moxie laughed. You just groaned and continued to massage the lizard woman.

"The father must be very happy." Prima said.

At that, Moxie's smile dropped. "Yeah, he is." She said, a hint of nervousness in her voice.

You sighed. "Prima, can you take over for me for a bit? I need to call my wife."

Prima shrugs and starts massaging the lizard woman while you hop off and head for the phone. You dial the station number. After two rings, you get an answer.

"Dreadberry Police Station. Sheriff Maggie Reaver speaking." Your wife replies.

"Maggie, it's me." You say.

1321211.title: Trouble times 8

13212111.content:
"I'm going to ask Lily to come to the station," said Maggie. "I think it would be best if I divulged the information in private." You give a gulp. "Are you sure that's a good idea, Maggie? That's like lighting a stick of dynamite." Maggie leans back in her chair at the other end of the line and lets out a sigh. "I know, Neil. But 8 gremlin/minotaur hybrids? Lily is going to know sooner or later. No use delaying the inevitable. I'm not going to enjoy this. Listen, Neil. I'm too stressed to cook tonight. Tell Sapphire that we're ordering a pizza tonight. Love you. Bye." "Goodbye." You hang up the phone as Prima looks down on you and crosses her arms.

"I figured as much," you mammoth boss says. "But octuplets? Seriously?" You gasp. "Keep your elephant ears out! That was a private conversation!" Prima simply rolls her eyes and gestures for you to get back to work.

Back at Maggie's office, Maggie is getting ready to call Lily to give her the bad news. "Irma," says Maggie as she presses the numbers on the phone. "Jolene. I need you both to leave the office and don't come back until after I speak with Lily." "Come on, Sheriff," whines Jolene. "You'll need our help with the arrest." Irma slaps herself in the face. "Jolene," she says. "When are you going to get it through your thick and empty head that not every case involves an arrest!?" Jolene hisses at the frost giantess. "Have you looked at our jail?! It's empty! What if somebody from out of town saw our cells with no criminals, other than the town drunk who lets herself in!" Sierra is asleep in her cell as this argument is going on and Maggie opens the cell before snapping her fingers to wake the drunk capricorn up.

“Sierra,” says Maggie. “I don’t want you to be in here when Lily comes in. Jolene, Irma. Please take Mrs. Cornwall home.” Irma lets out a sigh and Jolene then realizes something. "But we'll still have to arrest Lily after she kills Angus for his infidelity." "Jolene," says Irma. "Lily may be a kook but she's sane enough to realize an affair isn't worth somebody's life. She's not going to kill Angus. She's more likely to... demotivate him." As the deputies take Sierra away, Maggie nervously bites into a donut as she is waiting for Lily to respond. “Hello, Lily. I’m going to need you to come to the station. Alone. Thanks. See you later.”

Maggie knows that the conversations won’t end well, so as she hangs up, she begins to stuff herself with donut after donut until an hour later, Lily showed up. “What kept you?” asked Maggie as she took the last Boston Creme out of the box. Lily just blew out some smoke before putting her cigarette back into her mouth. “Angus took the car to be repaired today. I’m thinking of trading it in if this keeps up.” Maggie shakes her head and bites into her donut.“Lily,” she says. “We’ve been friends for a long, long, long time, right?” “Since the 3rd grade, Mag,” said Lily. “So what is it? I have it. You wanted to hear about the conspiracy going on at a certain television network.” Maggie raises an eyebrow. “Excuse me? Oh, for crying out loud, Lily. Put that cigarette out.” Lily drops the cigarette to the ground and snuffs it out with her hoof before speaking. “Minor villains from popular franchises are sneaking into the system intentionally creating bad shows as a means of getting revenge on the heroes who humiliated and defeated them.” Maggie rubs her chin. “That... that theory actually holds a lot of water.” “And the villains are those who either haven’t been seen in years or are otherwise too unimportant to go noticed.” Maggie then waves her hand. “That isn’t why I called you here. Lily, I have very sensitive information. Why don’t you sit down.”

The minotaur sits her fat butt down in the chair in front of Maggie’s dress as Maggie twitches her finger. “Angus has been “taking the car to get fixed” at least once a week for how long?” Lily scratches her chin. “5 years now,” said Lily. “I’m beginning to think that our Chokeswagon is a lemon.” Maggie shakes her head. “Lily. Have you seen Moxie lately yourself?” “Yep,” said Lily. “And might I say, she’s looking a little chubby these days. I know we’re not ones to throw stones but...” “She’s not fat,” said Maggie. “She’s pregnant. With octuplets.” “Huh,” said Lily. “That’s the first I heard of it. But Moxie’s single. Some hungry profligate must’ve been messing with her.”  Maggie bites her lip. “Funny you should mention it. Neil just recently told me something that he’s been keeping a secret for years. That night when you invited us over for game night, Neil accidentally got in your car when Angus took it to Moxie’s garage. He saw something that he thought you were better off not knowing. But now we have no choice. The father of Moxie’s octuplets, is your husband.” Lily gave a look of pure shock and dropped the cigarette she was about to light and place in her mouth. Maggie just stares at Lily in worry before Lily speaks.

“I thought it was strange that the Chokeswagon kept breaking down. All this time, Moxie was doing bodywork on Angus when I thought she was doing it on the car. It makes sense now." Maggie smiles nervously. "You're taking this rather well, Lily. Need me to..." "No," says the minotaur as she gets up. "I can walk home from here." Lily leaves the office as Maggie gives a gulp and opens another box of donuts and takes out a cruller.

- - - - - - - - -

Later that night, you, Maggie and Sapphire are eating pizza for dinner and Sapphire is scarfing up her portions but notices you and Maggie aren't eating your food. "Mom?" she asks. "Dad? Aren't you going to dig in." "Not just yet, Sweetie." You say nervously. "I'm not that hungry?" Sapphire raises an eyebrow and stares at Maggie. "I find that hard to believe, Mom. Is something wrong?" You stomp up to your daughter's plate and glare up at her. "Nothing that's any of your concern, young lady. Sapphire, sometimes adults are bothered by things that you shouldn't have to worry about." Sapphire picks off an anchovy from her pizza and eats it. "Does it have to do with Mr. Oxnard's affair with Ms. Axelrod."

You and Maggie drop your jaws. "You knew?" asks Maggie. Sapphire nods her head. "It wasn't exactly hard to figure out. Moxie is pregnant but not married and Mr. Oxnard drops off his car every week at her garage. Then you take into account that Mrs. Oxnard is not exactly mother material. I mean, she smokes like a chimney, she's insane and she's not a very a good cook. I mean, when was the last time she and Mr. Oxnard..." "You are not old enough to worry about that!" You yell. "But I'm sorry you had to figure that out."

Sapphire then realizes something. "You don't think that Mrs. Oxnard is going to be too angry do you?" Maggie scratches her chin. "I don't know. Well, Sapphire. Remember, Grandma lives two houses next to the Oxnards. She'd be the first to know if things got hairy." Maggie gives a nervous laugh. You let out a groan. "Stupid Cattleya." You mutter to yourself.

Speaking of which, I thing my hair, gut, spine and wings are in order and I'm in luck. You're on nail duty."

You were surprised at the woman who walked through the door. It wasn't often that an insect anthro showed up in Dreadberry. Doz was the only insect you knew, and she was only half-wasp.

This woman, however, was clearly 100 percent bee. She was around 925 feet tall. She had short, red hair and compound, black eyes. Sticking out of the top of her head were two antenna. Instead of a mouth, she had bee like mandibles. From the looks of it, she was incredibly pregnant. Her breasts looked like they were V-cups, and her butt was as big as Maggies. But her belly dominated her frame. It was easily as big as a bean bag chair. You saw that she had large wings on her back. She was wearing a tight, black robe.

You didn't think she looked like royalty, but you didn't want to risk questioning it. You walked over to her to introduce yourself.

"Hello," You shouted, "My name is Neil. Welcome to the Primordial Earth Salon and Spa."

The anthro bee looked down at you, with some difficulty considering her massive belly. "Good to meet you," she said in a thick Scottish accent. "The name's Delia O'Shay. I'm the queen bee of a nearby colony." So she was a queen bee.

"Please, follow me." You shout up.

You show Delia to the barber's chair where Prima was waiting.

"Mind if I take off my robe? It's been bugging me all day." Delia asks. Prima nods her head. Delia pulls her robe off in one motion, revealing that she was wearing black underwear underneath it. Delia slowly sits down as Prima gets the scissors ready.

"Do you have a TV?" Delia asks once she's settled in. "I want to see how the Slicers are doing." The Slicers were a national football team. You wondered why a queen qould care about that. Prima turns on the TV on the nearby wall and changes it to the sports channel.

"So, what brings you to Dreadberry?" Prima asks as she starts cutting Delia's hair.

"My colony move around a lot. We settled her about a month ago. We love where we are, but that mayor of your is getting uppity. Apparently, we have no permit to build out new nest. I'm heading there to talk to her, but one of my drones said to 'pretty up' first. I was a tomboy growing up and still am, so I don't see the point of this." Delia explains while she watches the game.

"Why don't you just send one of your drones to talk to the mayor?" You ask as Prima picks you up and drops you in Delia's hair to help her shampoo.

"Because I might be a queen bee, but I don't lie around all day popping out eggs. I still have duties to my colony. Public relations, finances, all that good stuff." Delia replies.

You continue shampooing her hair, but you step on a puddle of shampoo and slip off. You fall forward, screaming. Where do you land?

13312.content:
Lucky for you, you manage to land on Delia's mountain of a belly. It proved to be really soft, so you didn't get too hurt. Groggily, you stand up. The fuzz on Delia's body was only slighty shorter then you were.

"You alright down there?" Delia asked you.

"Yeah. I'm fine." You reply back.

"Well, since you're down there, think you could do some snipping down there? My fuzz gets itchy on my belly sometimes." Delia asks you.

You agree to do so. Prima hands you some large scissors so you can start cutting the fuzz. As you do so, you get curious.

"So, Delia, mind if I ask a few questions?" You ask.

"Sure" Delia replies.

"What's it like being a queen bee? I heard all they do is produce eggs."

"You're half right. The queens primary job is popping out eggs to keep the colony up, but some of us decide to take on other duties. Some queens do prefer only making more drones and do nothing else. I'm not one of them. Like I said, I deal in stuff like finances, relations, law creation, et cetera. There are some things I'm not part of, like directing honey gathering."

"How'd you become queen?"

"In my coloney, the next queen is chosen before the previous queen leaves. I was chosen due to being the queen's second-in-command for over 10 years. So, at 44, I became queen. And before you ask, as soon as I became queen, I was given a potion that made me massively pregnant. As soon as a pop out a bunch of eggs, new ones take their place."

"Are there any queens who don't make new drones?"

"Some. Obviously I'm not one of them. They leaving the egg making to someone else. Then there was Lita..."

"Why do you say it like that?"

"Well, she became queen at 26, and she's been pregnant with millions of young. Thing is, though, she loves being pregnant so much that she outright refuses to pop out any eggs. She hasn't produced a single egg in 30 years. That woman's belly is the size of a building now. They removed her from the queen position and appointed a new one. And even though she isn't queen anymore, she's still getting new eggs every day."

"Wow! Do you visit her at all?"

"Yeah, every week. I'm actually heading to her after I deal with the mayor." Delia then stops talking and thinks for a moment. Then she smiles. "You wanna see here?"

Do you?
