Jolene and a still frustrated Goldie exit and Maggie sits back down. "Say, if we ever do arrest a leprechaun do you think we could confiscate their gold?" she asks, rubbing her chin. "Boss, I'm pretty sure we can't do that. A leprechaun's pot of gold is like super important. Its a cultural thing." Irma tells her. "Well thats too bad." Maggie says. Just then a yawn sounds from one of the cells and the two look over to find Sierra just waking up. "Sierra! When did you get here?" Irma asks. "Sometime last night, I think. Jolene was the only person here when I slipped in." she says, holding her head. She's got a bad hangover. Maggie thinks back and remembers that she did tell Jolene to lock up. "Maybe we should start charging you rent." she says jokingly, but then stops and thinks seriously about it. "Boss?" Irma says. "Naah." Maggie responds and waves off her own thoughts. She can't charge rent in jail. At least, not unless she figures out a way. She decides to think on it later and heads to her office to do some paperwork.
1413221221211.title: Maggie

14132212212111.content:
At that moment, Maggie’s older sister Fiona walks into the station carrying a package. “Hello, Fiona,” says Maggie. “What brings you here?” Fiona stops and her jaw drops because she sees her sister’s fur glow bright gold. She even shields her eyes. “Did you dye your fur, Maggie?” asks Fiona in confusion. Maggie gives a nervous purr. “Uh,” she says. “Not exactly. I think it was Sapphire’s scale polish.” Fiona has to reach into her cleavage to put on a pair of sunglasses. “I bet. Maggie, the post office delivered this package to my house by mistake. It’s addressed to you.” “Oh!” yells Maggie. “Good. It came. Thanks, Fee.” Maggie snatches the package from her sister and holds out one of her claws. Maggie’s claws had also turned to gold and she opens the package as Jolene, Irma and Sierra all turn their heads in curiosity to see what comes out and it catches them by surprise.

The package contained yet another painting. This time the painting depicted an image of a Japanese junk that was made out of gold and depicted the junk carrying two titanic Japanese monsters in regal garbs. A kappa dressed as an emperor and a baku dressed as an empress. From the looks of it, the servants on board, including an army of samurai, were all humans. Everyone besides Maggie looks in surprise before Maggie hangs the painting up behind her desk. “There,” she says. “I think that brightens up the office. Worth every skull.” Irma looks in surprise and bends back so much she grunts as it irritates her spine. “You’re hanging that thing in the office?” Maggie gives a purr. “It’s my office and I’ve decided that it could use some sprucing up. Give it some class. How does it look, girls?”

Fiona, Sierra and Irma are speechless but Jolene has no qualms in speaking her mind. “I think it looks really cool. This will show visitors that we’re a higher breed of law enforcement.” Maggie gives a purr. “Hear that? At least Jolene is happy with it.” “Yeah,” mutters Fiona. “But everyone knows she has really bad taste.” Jolene hisses at Fiona as Irma gives a weak chuckle. “Maggie,” Fiona continues. “That painting looks like it cost a small fortune.” Maggie gave a scoff. “Pish-posh. Just something I bought with my winnings from the casino.” Fiona’s eyes popped. “Casino? Oh, you mean that new casino that opened in town. That surprises me. You’re not a gambling person.” Maggie shrugged her shoulders and stroked her large golden belly. “Something just got into me. Nothing to worry about, big sister. Wanna come to the casino tonight?” Fiona bites her lip nervously. “Casinos and I don’t really get along, Maggie. I met Fang in a casino, remember.” Maggie gives a slight growl. “That’s right. Well, maybe if you go to the casino again, you’ll meet somebody better than Fang.” Sierra gave a laugh from her jail cell and felt her head. “Any man would be preferable to Fang.” Fiona actually seems to consider Maggie’s suggestion and even scratched her head with her stinger tail.

At that moment, Maggie sees a car going by at extreme speed. “Hold that thought.” Maggie runs into her police car and goes after the speeder with sirens blaring. The woman in the car was a fat weresheep with red wool over her body and a woolly afro on her head. She was wearing a black skirt and polka dot shirt and was traveling 10 miles above the speed limit. The sheep woman heard sirens blaring and then turned around to see Maggie approaching her. The sheep woman pulled over as Maggie stopped her. Your enormous wolf stomps up towards the sheep woman and gives a sly smile. “Excuse me, ma’am. Do you realize that you were going 30 miles in a 20 mile zone. The sheep woman gives a bleat. “But Sheriff,” says the sheep. “I just caaaaaame here from Feaaaarfield to cover the Faaaate’s Haaaaaand Caaaaasino that just opened up.”

Maggie shakes her head and begins to write up a ticket. “That’s no excuse for speeding ma’am.” Maggie hands the sheep giantess a ticket and as the sheep looks at it, she screams. “300 Skulls for a speeding ticket! That’s highway robbery! I was only going 10 miles over the limit!” Maggie gives a purr. “Sorry, but if you don’t pay the ticket, I’m going to have to lock you up and impound your vehicle.” The sheep woman grumbles and takes out her wallet. “I haaaaate Nemeaaaan lions.” She moaned as she fished out the money.

Meanwhile, Fiona was walking away from the police station thinking about what she said. “Maybe Maggie’s right,” she says. “But that’s easy for her to say, she has Neil. I have nobody. Why should I walk into the casino? No man can be as perfect as my sister’s husband. If only I met him before she did. All I did was get stuck with a man who I loved and who left me. What to do, what to...” Suddenly, Fiona’s skin turns from green to a shade of pink and her hips begin to expand as her eyes spin. Something is coming over her, similar to what had come over Maggie. She then got a crazed smile on her face. “On second thought,” said the pink manticore who was expanding with every step she took. “Perhaps it is time I got back in the saddle.

- - -

Later that day, Maggie had gotten out of work but was going to the casino, leaving you and Sapphire to order out for dinner. You chew on a piece of rice as Sapphire slurps up some low mein. “Mom is going to the casino again?” asks Sapphire. You let out a sigh. “And she said she was bringing your aunt Fiona with her. I really hope this isn’t a recurring theme.” Sapphire gives a scoff. “Dad,” she says. “Mom does not have a gambling problem.” You let out a sigh. “I said that too. But now I’m not so sure.”

- - -

At that moment, Maggie and Fiona had arrived at the casino, Maggie glowing bright gold wearing a little black dress and Fiona glowing bright pink while wearing a little red dress. “Meow,” says Fiona. “Aren’t we both looking fine.” Maggie let out a laugh. “Okay, Fiona,” she says. “While you’re looking for a replacement for Fang, I’ll be hitting the games. I’m feeling lucky.” Fiona gave a purr. “So am I.” With that, both girls in the casino walked out to have an eventful night.”
14132212212111.title: Double Down

choices: You Fall Through her Pants and Slide Down her Leg
143.content:
As you're trapped in Maggie's crack wondering how you're going to get out of this situation (no matter how much you like it), you hear a door opening and then hear Maggie growling. "What are you doing here?" she asks. "Uh-oh," you think to yourself. "It can't be." It was. Into Maggie's office walked the one person Maggie didn't want to see, Prussia Kipling.

Prussia was a marshal assigned to Dreadberry, which you find weird considering, why would Dreadberry need both a sheriff and a marshal? This was a point Maggie agreed on all too well. Appearance wise, Prussia was a blue weretigress who looked like a bloated navi and dressed like an actual marshal out of the wild west. The tigress walked inside and Irma and Jolene quickly got out of the way as Maggie rose up out of her seat, forcing you to hold onto her waistband to keep from slipping down her pants.

Maggie growls at Prussia as Prussia comes in. "I wish you would stop with that nasty attitude, Maggie," says Prussia. "We're on the same side. You need all the help you can get with Dopey and Grumpy over there." She says this as she points to Jolene and Irma. Jolene lets out a gasp and turns to Irma. "How dare she call you Dopey." Irma rolls her eyes. Obviously Prussia was referring to Jolene as "Dopey". Maggie walks forward to Prussia and stares her in the eyes.

"Listen here, Marshal," she says. "We were doing fine before you blew into town. Why does Dreadberry even need a marshal?" Prussia lets out a laugh. "You should give this town credit. Some people actually think a marshal and a sheriff are the same thing? So, how are you doing catching Specter?" Maggie lets out a growl and blushes. "Not much luck. Nobody has even heard from him in weeks. And no, you didn't scare the bastard off, even though that is all too possible." "Burn." Comments Jolene. Prussia just turns her head and roars at Jolene to get her to back off. You shake your head.

It was no surprise that Maggie and Prussia didn't get along well. In fact, Meryl told you a long time ago that Nemean lions and weretigers rarely get along. However, as Maggie turns around to try and ignore Prussia, that blue tigress smiles seductively at Maggie and then smacks her in the butt, causing her to growl and you to grunt as the slap shook Maggie's rear and nearly made you fall through. "Looks like the queen of beasts has some junk in the trunk," says Prussia with a grin. "Just how I like it." Maggie growls and then slaps Prussia in the face. You give a glare yourself.

That was the one thing you hated most about Prussia. You could accept she was a lesbian, but she was always hitting on Maggie. Prussia had no idea Maggie was married despite Maggie trying to tell her. Unfortunately, Maggie didn't tell Prussia that you were a human because she doesn't think that Prussia would understand. Prussia believed that the only thing humans were good for was eating and assumed Maggie was a predator as well.

"You know Prussia," says Maggie angrily. "You need to keep your hands to yourself. My husband wouldn't like it." "There you go on again," says Prussia as she rolls her eyes. "When am I going to meet this alleged husband of yours?" Maggie bites her lip nervously as she tries to think of an excuse.

To make matters worse...
143.title: Lions and Tigers

1432.content:
As you're struggling to get free, Prussia hears you and looks down in surprise to see you between Maggie's enormous ass cheeks. You give a look of fear as the tiger giantess licks her lips and then plucks you out as Maggie jumps up and screams. "Well lookie what I've found," says Prussia as she stares at you with hungry eyes. "A snack." You let out a scream as Prussia opens her mouth and shows you her enormous fangs, ready to devour you.

But before Prussia can place you into her mouth, Maggie turns around and gasps. "Prussia!" she yells. "Put him down!" Prussia closes her mouth and lets out a sigh. "Fine," she says. "You can have a bite." "You don't understand, Prussia," says Maggie. "That's my husband!" Prussia drops her jaw in surprise before Maggie takes you from Prussia's hand and pushes you against her (face) cheek. "Not again, Neil," says Maggie. "How many times have you been plastered to my ass?" You shrug your shoulders. "I lost count." You then kiss Maggie as she purrs.

"Husband?!" yells Prussia. "You mean, you actually HAVE a husband?! And he's a human of all thing?!" Maggie nodded her head. "I'm sorry Prussia, but I'm not a lesbian. Besides, I don't see anything wrong with marrying a human." "Nothing wrong?" asks Prussia. "Humans are food, Maggie! Please tell me you're at least planning on eating him down the road." Maggie lets out a growl at Prussia. "Leave." She says.

Prussia growls back and stomps out of Maggie's office before Maggie looks down at you. "I better get you to work," she says as she pets you. "Before Prima and Atlanta have a conniption fit." You let out a laugh. "Thanks for saving me from Prussia." "You took the words out of my mouth," says Maggie. "That woman is a total creep."

However, what neither Maggie or you realized was that as Prussia was walking down the street, she was thinking about you and Maggie and mumbling to herself. "Unbelievable. All this time she was married to a human! Why didn't anyone tell me she was straight!? That means that Sapphire is... ugh. That's enough to kill a gal's appetite." Prussia stopped to scratch away at a fence as she pondered the situation. "She can't be serious. Doesn't she realize I could make her happier than that... that appetizer. After all, we're both cats. I'll bet I'd make a better parent for Sapphire than someone she could swallow whole by accident." As Prussia scratches a fence post into the likeness of Maggie, she hears an angry scream.

"HEY! You bloody tiger! What're you doing to my fence!?" That voice was none other than Cattleya, your mother-in-law. Cattleya outright despise you and the thought of a human son-in-law filled her with disgust. Prussia backed away as the splinter cat stepped back. "Oh," said Prussia. "Cattleya. Darn sorry about that?" Cattleya then looked at the carving and realized who it was a carving of. "You're twenty years too late, cowgirl. Some minuscule little parasite beat you to it. Of all the species, she HAD to fall in love with a bloody human." "Exactly," says Prussia. "It doesn't take a genius to know she'd be better off with another cat. Humans are only good for eating." Cattleya lets out a scoff. "If he weren't married to my youngest daughter, I would swallow that pest with some rum. Not only is he married to Maggie but my other daughter has been stalking him ever since that ratbag Fang walked out on her! The only decent thing about him is Sapphire!"

What both cats don't realize is that somebody overheard their conversation. That somebody was a certain voluptuous victorian banshee woman with green, pink and blue hair. Raven Dark. "Hey!" yelled Raven as she flew down. Her shrieking causing Cattleya and Prussia to plug their ears. "Don't you talk smack about Neil." Said Raven. "He's the cutest thing I've ever seen." Raven lets out a fangirl shriek and shakes her arms as Cattleya and Prussia continue to hold their ears. "Bloody banshee." Mutters Cattleya. Raven then let out a sigh. "Too bad by the time I found him, he had already settled down with an overfed alley cat." Then Raven grunted because Prussia grabbed her by the dress. "You take that back, you screaming cow! Maggie is perfection! It's a shame she's the one married to Neil."

While Raven and Prussia are arguing, Cattleya is thinking to herself and then the splinter cat comes up with an idea. "Quiet!" she shouts. Raven and Prussia stop and then turn to your mother in law. "What we have here is a conflict of interests." First she points to Prussia. "You want my daughter's hand." Then Cattleya points to Raven. "And you have the bad taste to want the man who already has it. I don't care as long as I don't have to put up with that parasite in law for a long time. Come in."

Soon the trio are in Cattleya's house. "It seems," says Cattleya. "We need to find a way to separate those two." Prussia let out a purr. "I see what y'all are sayin'. I get Maggie and the Mad Hatter's daughter over there gets Neil." Raven is about to shriek again but Prussia puts her hat over the banshee's mouth. "Well," says Cattleya. "We better think of something. I know I haven't had much luck on the matter after 20 long years." The banshee, splintercat and weretiger all sit at Cattleya's dining room table to think of a way to break you and Maggie up.

But who comes up with the first idea?

That was when Raven clapped her hands. "I know," says the banshee. "I was saving this for a special occasion." Raven reached into her gorge sized cleavage and takes out a bottle shaped like a heart with a bubbling pink liquid inside. "What the hell is that?" asks Cattleya. Raven giggles and then shapes her ghostly birthing hips. "It's exactly what it looks like," she says in a singsong tune. "A love potion."

Prussia lets out a slight growl as she hears this. "Raven," she says. "Love potions are illegal. I am an officer of the law y'all know." "I know," says Raven. "But desperate times call for desperate measures. After all, I'm Neil's real soulmate and not some overfed, so-called queen of beasts." Cattleya gives an angry glare and shows Raven her claws. "Well..." the voluptuous ghost stole a glance towards Cattleya, who was fuming over the foiled plan. "...yes. There is a cure."

Fine with me." reluctantly, Raven hands her the love potion, and after combining the necessary reagents, you find yourself drinking the mixture from the thimble (which was emptied and refilled), and the mental images of Prussia are replaced by those of your rotund wife. You cough and shake your head, and Maggie rubs your shoulder with the tip of one of her claws. Now back to your senses, you look up to her and thank her, rubbing the fur of her chest and making her purr gently. A wail, however, ends the tender moment.

"Oh? You never had me to begin with, and Neil has always been with me." however. her tone changed abruptly, as a thought just occurred in her head. "...But you know what... I think I have the perfect solution to both your problems." you cannot help but look at your wife, surprised by her lighter tone. Maggie's expression, however, is one you know well, even if she's rarely like this, she's planning something devious. Prussia and Raven also seem to caught on, and look intimidated.

"You two will put each other's DNA sample on the tea cups, and then you will drink them."

Satisfied with the result, Dreadberry's sheriff continued before anyone could object. "However, IF you refuse, there will be consequences, for starters, Raven, you were in possession of an illegal item, and I am bound by the law to arrest you for such. And you, Prussia, you can be sure I'll speak of this to the Mayor, and I don't think she'll be in the mood to deal with your shenanigans, in fact, worst case scenario, she might revoke your marshall badge."

At this, the splintercat took a step forward, her voice low. "Now, Maggie, you're taking this too far. There's no need t-" she was cut short as the large lioness turned to her, her face

"As for you, Mother dearest, you can be damn well sure I'll tell your granddaughter what you just tried to pull, and you can also expect to spend a very lonely Christmas, this year." for the first time ever, you see the mother-in-law who despises you so much falter. Fine, send her over."

Maggie hangs up the phone and growls in frustration. "What's wrong, Boss?" Asks Jolene. "The mayor says we're not making enough progress on the Specter case, so she's hired a bounty hunter to get the job done." For the last six months, Dreadberry has been terrorized by a string of bank robberies. But no evidence has been found as to who the perpetrator could be, no fingerprints, DNA, nothing. Whoever it is somehow breaks into the vault, clears out the money, and vanishes without a trace. But there are no signs of forced entry, and nothing ever appears on the bank's security cameras. The mysterious thief has been dubbed "The Specter", because it seems as though he can just walk through the walls of the vault.

"Who is this bounty hunter?" Jolene asked. Maggie growls again "Bona Fete." Maggie hated bounty hunters, and especially Bona Fete. They had never met, but she knew Bona by reputation. She was the most feared and relentless bounty hunter in the entire monster world, a loose cannon willing to kill her targets no matter what their crimes may be. Jolene on the other hand, idolized Bona Fete, and squealed with glee when Maggie said her name.

"No way! You mean the Bona Fete? This is gonna be awesome!"

Maggie growls at the car that just cut her off. “You’re lucky I have to take my daughter to school, you jerk! Honestly Neil. They’ll give anyone a driver’s license these days. That’s when you hear a zipping noise and gasp. Sapphire didn’t know it, but she accidentally zipped you inside her backpack with her textbooks. As Maggie starts driving again, you climb a textbook. “Maggie!” you yell. “Sapphire! Stop the car!” But unfortunately neither your wife nor daughter can hear you. It looks like you’re going with Sapphire to Nightmare High.

You soon hear the door open and Sapphire runs out. “Bye Mom!” she yells. “Bye Dad! I’ll see you later.” If only she knew here dad was in her backpack. This was not good. You can only hope Maggie realizes something’s up. Sapphire walks into Nightmare High and finds Emerald, your rag doll niece waiting for her. Emerald smiles as Sapphire comes up and shakes her hand. “Emerald,” says Sapphire. “Good to see you cuz.” Emerald grins and shows the zipper over her mouth. Although you were glad that Meryl and Flint enchanted themselves a little one of their own, you wish that Emerald wasn’t so creepy. You can’t remember the last time she spoke.

Sapphire and Emerald walk into the schoolhouse and you watch as many monster teenagers both male and female pass by. Down the hall was Sapphire’s closest friends; Topaz the Chinese dragon, Onyx the Carbuncle and Sapphire’s B.F.F., Ruby the Orthrus. Makes you wonder why all Sapphire’s friends were named after gems. “Good morning Sapphire, Emerald.” Says Topaz as she opens her locker. Ruby walks up and gives Sapphire their secret handshake and you close your eyes. Sapphire wouldn’t like it if you knew. “Hey Ruby,” said Sapphire. “If you see your brother, tell him congratulations for me.” Ruby’s two heads give a smile. “Thanks Sapphire,” says the right head. “You don’t know,” says the left head. “How much it means..” “For Norville...” “To be working with machines.” You remember that Moxie recently gave Ruby’s brother a job at her garage. You’d tell Ruby congrats yourself, but you could never speak to her properly. Trying to communicate with two headed monsters gave you a monster headache.

Onyx, that carbuncle finally notices Sapphire and turns her head. You see that she’s eating some kind of candy, a little too early in the morning for that, but you couldn’t tell what it was. “Oh, Sapphire. Didn’t see you over the weekend G.F. Oh, you weren’t sick were you? You were sick and didn’t tell me? That’s just plain rude.” Sapphire lets out a roaring laugh. “I wasn’t sick Onyx. I was studying for Ms. Tavi’s big math test.” Onyx continues to stuff her face and then holds out the bag. “Knock it off Sapphire. You’re the smartest girl I know, you’ll do fine. Say, you want some candy coated humans? I’ve got plenty. You gasp in horror as Onyx mentions exactly what she was eating.

“Yuck!” yells Sapphire in disgust. “Onyx! I’m part human!” Realizing that she accidentally offended her friend, Onyx puts her snack away as Topaz simply rolls her eyes. “Too much sugar early in the morning ruins the brain,” says Topaz. “It is you I worry about Onyx.” “Hey,” says Ruby. “Where...” “Is Pearl.” Sapphire walks forward and then bumps against something, or rather someone. “Ouch!” Sapphire looks down at a familiar dark skinned gargoyle girl who has her arms crossed. “Oh, sorry about that Pearl. I didn’t...” “You didn’t see me,” says Pearl mockingly. “I’ve heard it all before.” Pearl may have been Sapphire’s friend but she had a temper on her. You couldn’t tell by looking at her but she’s abnormally small for a gargoyle. Since her aunt and cousin are as big as Maggie it’s especially frustrating for her. You wonder why Pearl would hang out with Sapphire and the girls given they obviously tower over her.

“I see you’re extra angry this morning Pearl,” says Topaz. “All that self-directed rage is eating you alive.” “Save the fortune cookies for after school Topaz,” says the gargoyle girl. “You’d be angry too if your boyfriend dumped you for a freaking nuckelavee. It’s like my Auntie Destiny says, men are poison.” “That’s only because she can’t accept that she was a victim of karma,” says Topaz. “She’s as much to blame for what happened as... what did you say his name was.” Pearl got so mad her eyes glowed bright. You gulp and hide further into Sapphire’s backpack. “Don’t make me take out your dragon balls.”

Before Pearl could do anything she’d regret, Sapphire lifts her up and lets out a sigh. “You remind me of my Grandma,” she says. “She’s always mad at Dad for something stupid.” Onyx lets out a laugh. “Yeah, that’s one problem when you marry outside your own species.” Onyx lets out a laugh before Emerald lightly taps her on the back of her head. You could just laugh at the carbuncle’s stupidity if it weren’t for the fact you just remembered you were in a high school for giant monsters and Sapphire had no idea.

Suddenly the ground begins to shake and you scream as you grab the spine of Sapphire’s math book. “Looks like Headmistress Wayne fell asleep again.” Says Sapphire. “She can,” “Sleep all day,” “If she wants.” Says Ruby’s two heads.

You shiver. Headmistress Wayne was the world’s biggest monster. She was almost twice Maggie’s height and that was saying something. The woman was no ordinary monster, but a monster mutated by human experiments. The woman was so big that her office was underneath the school and not inside it. Of course, Sapphire and her friends were heading to class now. You don’t remember Sapphire’s schedule so you don’t know which teacher she’ll run into. Well, which class are you unintentionally following your daughter to?

Especially when she's forced to hit the brakes." "You're lucky I found him when I did," says Colleen. "There are monsters in this school with poor enough taste to gulp your father down." You look to see Sapphire opening her locker.

"Hey!" you yell as Sapphire places you inside. Sapphire lowers her head to your level and lets out a slight mew. "I'm sorry Dad, but this school is dangerous to humans. You're lucky the teacher who found you was Ms. Howler. If she didn't hate the taste of humans... ugh. I don't even want to think about it. Just stay there. I'll call Mom and tell her you're alright." Sapphire, Ruby, Emerald and Pearl walk into a classroom as you finally manage to climb up the side of your daughter's backpack and breathe deeply. Then you grunt and have to hold on as Sapphire takes her seat and puts her backpack at the side of her desk.

You look out to see monster students of all species. You see a nerdy looking and flat chested succubus girl with a pair of swirled glasses like the kind you'd see in an anime, sitting next to Sapphire. She was Lee's daughter Donna Gin. Then you turn and see your rag doll niece, Emerald, sitting next to and appearing to be smiling at another boy. This one appears to be were owl boy who appeared to be flirting with her. You're definitely going to be telling Meryl about that when you got home. You manage to unzip yourself from the backpack and climb out. It looks like everyone's eyes were on the chalkboard. Then you realize something. You didn't know whose class this was. You were nervous at the thought of running into the giantess in charge of the class.

Suddenly the door opens up and you see a pair of thunder thighs, no, make that hurricane hips, walk in. They were bright gold colored wrappings around them and that prompts you to look further up to see a large gauze covered stomach that revealed tan Egyptian skin in some of the gaps in the wrappings. Further up you see a chubby face with more gauze covering only the nose and long black hair that looked almost blue. The mummy giantess was wearing nothing more than a black shirt and red jacket and on her arms were tattoos that resembled hieroglyphics.

You breathe a sigh of relief as the teacher entered the room. You knew this one. Her name was Taleela Khamen, legally changed from Talealakamen. She was the friendliest teacher in the school and thankfully, she forbade monsters from eating humans in her class. Taleela taught history, because what better teacher for history than a woman who was thousands of years old. There was a rumor that before Taleela was mummified, she was the queen of Egypt. Why would someone who used to rule, work for a school.

Taleela closed the door and put her books down on her desk. "Morning and bienvenue class," said Taleela. "Today we'll be continuing our study on the Werewolf-Vampire War of 1712. And just to be frank, I don't want anything you learn in class today mentioned to Ms. Howler. That goes for you too Ms. Cain." By this, Taleela was talking to a vampiress in the corner of the room who merely lets out a hiss.

1541.content:
It only takes a moment's thought before you decide to try and get Sapphire's attention--she's the safest option, being the closest monster to you AND your daughter. (Emerald is a few seats over, leaving plenty of time for you to get snatched up and eaten by one of her classmates before she even sees you; Taleela seemed so caught up in her lecture she likely wouldn't even see you at all.) With a grunt of effort, you leap back onto Sapphire's backpack and start to climb, starting at the mesh bottle-holder on the side...and you have quite a way to go--at your size and speed, it'll take the better part of an hour to reach the top.

The strain on your limbs isn't helping, either. You just knew you were gonna pull something after this...dammit.

During your climb, your attention starts to drift to Miss Khaman's lesson.

"Last class,we left off just as the War started...can anyone tell me--whithout looking at their notes--where and when that was?" Miss Khaman opens.
A few students groan when she forbids them from checking their notes, but your daughter isn't one of them.

You look up to see Sapphire raising her hand. "July 8th, 1712? Between...Lycanthropolis and Vladistan?"

"Right on the money both times, Sapphire; good work."
Despite the strain of climbing--by now you'd just passed the drink-holder--you smile at Miss Khaman's praise for your daughter. Darn right she'd get it on the first try, with her near-constant studying. You wondered why she was so worried about her grades. Just how nasty WAS that Mikki Tavi...?

Halfway up...goddammit, your arms hurt! And your grip wasn't the firmest, either--the backpack wasn't exactly a nice, hard climbing wall with lots of easy grips. And you weren't quite as spry as you were at Sapphire's age, as much as you tried to keep in shape.
Yeah, you were definietly gonna need an asprin after this...

"...first stage of the war went to Lycanthropis, since the werewolf city-state had already been on a war footing; putting down insurrections in its coastal territory just a few years before," Miss Khamen went on, the squeaks and grinds of her chalk on the blackboard. "Their initial push from the east in July and August claimed large swaths of Vampire land, including some small silver mines, cutting through the Vampires' supply of one of their major weaknesses. Unfortunately for the Werewolves, this sort of blitz stretched their supply lines quite thin..."

You stop to catch your breath, almost within reach of the top of the backpack...
Well, you actually stopped a short while ago, but got caught up in the history lesson. As much as you mentally kick yourself for that, this was pretty interesting. Maybe you should talk to Maggie about upgrading the cable to get the historical channels? Or at least hit the library sometime.

Filing that thought away, you pull yourself over some more folds and wrinkles before you finally, FINALLY reach top of Sapphire's backpack!
...You'd cheer if you weren't so whupped. On the plus side, you'd probably made up for all the times you'd missed working out in the past, oh; six months? Well, time to do what you came here for.

With another grunt of effort, you stand up and start waving your arms around. "Sapphire! Down here! It's your father!!" You shout. "I fell in your backpack! Help!"

Your daughter is busy taking notes, but the classroom is quiet save for Miss Khaman's lesson. Will Sapphire notice you...?

Sapphire's ears twitch and then she looks down in surprise as she sees you. "Dad?!" she yells in surprise. Ms. Khaman actually stops writing at the board before she notices you and gasps as Sapphire holds you up. "Oh my. Sapphire, did your father get stuck in your backpack." Sapphire looks in embarrassment as the whole class has their eyes on her. She nods her head and you give a nervous smile. "I'm sorry, Taleela. I guess there are some disadvantages to being small." Taleela then walks forward and takes you from Sapphire. "I'm afraid that this classroom is a dangerous place for humans. I'll have to hold your father until the end of the day for his own protection." Sapphire nods her head. "Yes, Ms. Khaman."

- - -

At the end of the school day, Sapphire returns to Ms. Khaman's room and picks you up. "Thank you, Ms. Khaman." Says Sapphire. "Thanks, Taleela." You say. Ms. Khaman gives a sweet smile and then nods her head. "Oh," she says. "Don't worry, child. I was human once you know. Now, take care." As Sapphire walks out of the room, she carries you on your head. "I'm sorry to embarrass you, pumpkin," you say. "I didn't mean to cause a fuss." Sapphire lets out a sigh. "I'm just glad you're alright, Dad. If Ms. Tavi saw you, you'd be doomed." "Speaking of which, how did you do on the math test?" Sapphire gives a look of embarrassment. "A+." You give a laugh. "See, Sapphire. You were worried about nothing." Sapphire walks outside and sees Maggie waiting for you both.

As Sapphire gets into the car, Maggie takes you off of Sapphire's head and puts you on the dashboard. "There you are, you troublemaker. Thank goodness you're alright." "Give me some credit, Maggie," you say. "I may not be indestructible like you, but I'm as resourceful as ever." Maggie gives a smile and then kisses you as she drives off. She was in a good mood. "Oh," says Maggie. "Una and Pauline are in town and they've got quite a surprise for you both." Sapphire gives a blink. "Una and Pauline."

Maggie was referring to two of her cousins. Una was a Nemean lioness witch doctor who lived all the way in Direopolis. You knew her well because the last time she was in town, she gave Fiona a voodoo doll of her ex-husband as a birthday present. If only Fiona wasn't too nice to use it to her advantage. As for Pauline, she was a bright black-furred Nemean lioness who lived in Screamtown and ran a restaurant called Narnia that specialized in gourmet food. Last time you heard, she had a human boyfriend who came from a family of literal harpies. You didn't mind those two. They both lived in towns where it was illegal for monsters to eat humans. You just hope they remembered to wear clothing. After all, even though they had fur to hide it, it was still not a good thing for Sapphire to see.

"What do your cousins want?" Maggie gives a giggle. "They've invited us to see a magic show." Suddenly, Sapphire's jaw drops and she gives an excited look. "Magic show?" she asks with a huge smile on her face. Maggie nods her head. "The Amazing Great Lakeinski is in town and Una and Pauline bought tickets to the show tomorrow night." "That's amazing." You say. You loved a good magic show. The last time you saw one was when Sapphire turned 10 years old. This was going to be fun.

Maggie parks the car outside of the house and outside waiting for the both of you is none other than...

15432.content:
This was it, you were going to reach the top of Taleela's head. "This is it," you say to yourself. "Just a little closer." Unfortunately at that moment, the bandage you're holding onto suddenly snaps and you yell as you slip and fall between several of Taleela's bandages. You grumble as you're caught in the gauze, but the more you struggle the worse it gets util you're tied up yourself and let out muffled shouts. Now, only your eyes were visible and from the point where you are, you can see that you’re stuck to Ms. Khamen’s left butt cheek. You give a groan at your position.

The only rear you could tolerate being trapped under was Maggie’s. She’s sat on you more times than you can count during your 20 year marriage so you have experience being buried under monster girl booty, but Taleela’s butt was different from Maggie’s as there was no fur anywhere. Also, it was somehow squishy and stiff at the same time due to Taleela’s dry mummified skin. You wonder to yourself how it’s even possible for a mummy to be so fat. For the most part, Taleela’s butt was almost as big as Maggie’s.

It isn’t long until the school breaks for lunch and Taleela retreats to the teacher’s lounge. You struggle and try to shake your way out of the bindings and even pound on Taleela’s fat ass but she doesn’t feel a thing and you’re no closer to getting free. Taleela at the moment was at a water cooler when you spot Mrs. Keys walking by and gasp. Taleela walked out of the way and saw that the griffin was grumpy. “What’s wrong, Ophelia?” “Some thief stole the box of humans I needed for my science class tomorrow. Now I have to reschedule everything.” You begin to sweat. You seriously don’t want to know what Mrs. Keys had in mind for those humans. Taleela gives a look of horror and disgust. “You are very crude, Ophelia.” Ophelia just gives a scoff and waddles away. You give a sigh of relief that Mrs. Keys didn’t see you. It was going to be a long day. Maggie was going to be really worried later.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  

When the school day is over, Taleela walks up to her car with you still stuck to her butt. Taleela’s car was a bright red colored sports car with a hood ornament of the Egyptian goddess Bastet on the front and six wheels. Taleela sits down right on top of you as you grunt and are forced between her butt cheeks, further trapping you in the gauze. This was going to take a while to explain to Maggie. Taleela let out a mutter as she started the car. “I think I need to replace the seat cushion soon. It’s starting to get lumpy.” You grumble as you try to chew through the gauze and at least free your mouth. You immediately regret your decision as your mouth is burning. “When was the last time Taleela changed her bandages?” you think to yourself.

Taleela soon arrives at her house and gets out of the car. You look and see that Taleela’s house is actually a large blue pyramid and there appears to be a pool in the back with gold statues of the Egyptian gods decorating the back yard. Taleela walks up to the door and unlocks it before coming in. You look in surprise at the interior of Taleela’s pyramid. From the looks of it, it appears to be a crypt of some kind and there are hieroglyphs on the wall. You see one that depicts Taleela when she was alive. She was still heavy back then but was dressed in regal attire. You turn your eyes and then you see what appears to be a golden throne in front of the television. Of course, there was also a giant mummified cat sleeping on a cat bed nearby and that made you nervous. You had no idea Taleela had a cat. Must’ve been her pet in life. You may have a thing for felines but you had no idea whether or not Taleela's cat was friendly.

Taleela also had an ankh hung on the wall and in the corner of the room was an enormous sarcophagus that was lined with a mattress. On the shelf there were 4 canopy jars that you guess held Taleela's organs. From the looks of it, Taleela's pyramid had a mix of ancient Egypt and new technology as it clearly had electricity and running water. Taleela walks to the corner and hangs up her jacket. As she does so, you see that near the coat hanger is a dummy head wearing an Egyptian bejeweled headdress of some sort. Perhaps the theory of Taleela being a queen in life had some leverage to it. But why would somebody who was a queen before she died apply for a teaching job in a high school upon resurrection?

Before you can think about that, you remember you're stuck in between the mummy's butt cheeks and at that moment, Taleela was heading to...
15432.title: Under Wraps

155.content: Well, which class is first?
155.title: More Options

choices: You Reach Sapphire and She Looks Down and Sees You
Uma Sees You and Snatches You Up Before Anyone Notices You
One of Sapphire's Classmates Grabs You
1551.content:
As you try to zip out of Sapphire's backpack you see your daughter walking into a classroom, however, you didn't know where she was going. You saw that both Ruby and Topaz were walking by her sides and Emerald. When Sapphire arrives in the classroom, you see that she hangs her backpack on a rack as do all the other students. You let out a grunt and take a look around. From the looks of it, besides Sapphire and her friends, there were 12 students in the classroom.

You decide to take a quick look at the students before descending. In the first row there were three students, first was one you recognized, Donna Gin. Donna was the daughter of your customer, Lee the succubus. Lee had light gray skin and blue hair like her mother except she was much skinnier than Lee, had smaller horns and a flat chest. She even worn glasses with swirl designs on them. You'd never tell it to Lee, but Donna was so homely that you couldn't believe she was a succubus.

Next to Lee was a cobalt skinned European dragon boy who looked like one of the jocks. He had a scar on his face and was staring at Topaz who waved at him. You're guessing that was Topaz's boyfriend. A Chinese dragon dating a European dragon. That's not something you see everyday. Also in the third row was a scarlet feathered hippogriff with the legs of a zebra wearing a pair of glasses who you also recognized. That was Grevy Keys, the science teacher's son. You don't know if he's like his mother and you sure don't want to find out.

The second row had five students, the first of which you also recognized, she was a lavender furred hue, a monster resembling a baboon with tiger limbs and a snake for a tail. That Nue was Glinda Osbourne. She was a rival student of Sapphire's that she couldn't stand. To the side of Glinda was a fat pure white glowing furred hellhound girl with five pairs of eyes running down to her skull-like snout. She was dressed like a delinquent and you make note to steer clear of that one. Next to her was a green skinned and slightly overweight looking werelizard boy who looked like a mix between a frilled lizard and an otaku and next to him was a vermillion skinned mock turtle punk girl with multiple piercings in her face. You hope to high heaven that Sapphire stood clear of her. Next to the mock turtle girl was one monster guy that you immediately glare at. He was an indigo skinned tengu who appeared to be dressed as a greaser, complete with a pompadour and jacket. He quickly put out a cigarette (which weren't allowed in school) as he smiled at Sapphire. You grit your teeth as you look at that tengu boy. He's not getting your daughter without a fight.

Then came the four students in the third row. There was an orange were crocodile girl with yellow stripes. She looked like a Goth girl and had a patch over one of her eyes for some reason. Next to the crocodile girl was an aqua skinned werecrab boy in a hood. He looked a lot like an emo. Next to him was a magenta furred drop bear girl, a monster resembling an obese carnivorous koala bear with a white main on her shoulders. She was holding hands with a crimson skinned python boy, a dragon resembling an actual python but with three eyes and six arms that doubled as legs.

As you slide down from the string on Sapphire's backpack, you look to see that the alleged classroom looks more like a a kitchen of some kind. "Oh no." You groan. To confirm your suspicions, into the room walked the teacher. Her name was Uma D. Kay, she was a giant blue skinned boomer whose fashion sense and beehive hairstyle were stuck in the 1950s. You'd even wager a guess that that was when she died. Uma was the home etc. teacher, which explained the kitchen setup. But you wished you weren't in that sumo zombie's class because Uma had a crush on you so much that she asked you if you were planning to divorce Maggie and try your hand at a new girl, right in front of Maggie. You swear that if that woman weren't already dead, she'd have a death wish.

You walk up into the classroom just as class begins. "Good morning class." Says Uma. "Good morning, Ms. Kay." Uma gives a smile that reveals a hole in her cheek, exposing her molars. "Alright class. Today, I'll be splitting you up in teams of two. You gulp. Oh no. Who was she going to team Sapphire up with. "Team one," says Uma. "Topaz River and George Knight." Topaz walked up to her European dragon boyfriend as they both breathed out heart shaped flames. "Team two, Ruby Welker and Donna Gin." Donna and Ruby walked together. "Team three, Melissa Tortellini and Gou Jojima." The mock turtle punk and the frilled were lizard otaku boy teamed up.

Uma had to take out one of her eyeballs and wipe it off before she announced the remaining teams. "Team four, Grevy Keys and Glinda Osbourne." Grevy flew up to Glinda and Glinda turned her head in disgust. Oblivious she didn't think much of Grevy. "Team five, Helene Guinness and Eugene Brown." Helene, the delinquent hellhound girl walked up to the emo were crab who just said "Whatever". "Team six, Emerald Morpheus and Joan Elton." Emerald walked up to the goth crocodile girl. "Team seven, Sydney Osgood and Monty Cleese." The drop bear girl and her python boyfriend both smiled to each other. But then you realized something and gasped. That left only Sapphire and... "Team eight, Sapphire Reaver and Keppei Suwabe."

You mentally scream as Sapphire is paired with that tengu greaser. He was obviously bad news and he seemed too happy to be paired with your daughter. You wish you could just strangle him, if you were a few hundred feet bigger. But it doesn't matter because class was in session. "Alright class, I hope you studied since last class because today, we're going to be preparing one of my favorite dishes but also one of the hardest to cook. Vegetable devil lamb, right brain." To emphasize this, Uma hands each team the left half of some kind of strange green brain that had some algae growing on it. "Remember class, this is a special preparation ingredient.

All sixteen students including your daughter and niece turn on the stoves and prepare to cook as Uma walks around the class. You know you should be escaping but as you see Sapphire with Keppei you couldn't stand the fact that your own daughter was assigned as a partner to such an obvious creep. You were going to give him a piece of your mind and walk towards your daughter's station, safety be darned.

But do you reach Sapphire...
1551.title: Home Shriek

1553.content:
Sapphire walks into a classroom and you feel her set her bag down. The zipper opens and she reaches in to grab some of her books. You try to call out to her, but she can't hear you. Deciding to persevere you climb the remaining books and reach the top of the bag. When you get to the opening you climb out and end up tumbling down to the floor. When you pick yourself up you are promptly knocked back down by the ground rumbling. A pair of paws passes right by you and you look up to see who its is. You are met with a pair of underwear on a gigantic ass under a black skirt. Attached to the furry ass is the upper body of a bird. Its a gryphon, which means it must be Ophelia Keys, the science teacher. You get nervous and back up toward the feet of your daughter. Ophelia is one of the more dangerous teachers in the school. She's like a mad scientist and you've heard she's not too kind to humans.

As you head closer to Sapphire Ophelia stops by her desk. You hear them talking and then Ophelia praises her. Science is Sapphire's best subject, so it makes sense the teacher would like her. Maybe she's only mean to humans. You ignore the chatter above and reach your daughter's foot. You take a breath and jump on in an attempt to get her attention. Unfortunately you fail and after a couple minutes of trying you tire out. While you rest she gets up and starts walking, making you hold on for dear life. You see that she's headed for the blackboard to write something for the class. While she does this you relax a little and catch your breath. Soon however Sapphire finishes and begins walking back to her desk. The motion launches you off of her foot and under a nearby desk. When the desk's owner returns you gulp when you see its Ophelia.

The gryphon sits down and begins going through some papers as the class works. You stand at her feet in fear, hoping she won't find you. One paw comes forward and lands on top of you. She rolls you around like a ball of lint and eventually traps you between her toes. You try to break free but its no use. You're helpless as she plays with you like an insignificant little toy. Its not so bad at first, but as class goes on your body begins to ache. Not to mention her toes are starting to sweat a little and coat your body in it. When the bell rings you hear the students getting up, as does Ophelia. When she walks away from her desk she unclenches her toes and you spring free. With a gasp of air you run toward Sapphire, who is just leaving. You curse your luck at having just missed her, but someone else sees you. Who is it?
1553.title: Science with Mrs. Keys

choices: Promises To Help You After Work (Takes You With Her)
15532.content:
You find yourself being scooped up by a giant hand. You look in fear at your captor, but are relieved to see its not Ophelia. Its a girl, and at first glance you think she's human. Then you see her pointed ears and realize she's a monster. As she walks out of the classroom you see that she's got an hourglass body with curly red hair and freckles. She's also wearing a green shirt with a matching skirt. "Um, excuse me." you call up to her. She looks down at you and smiles. "Hey little guy. I was wondering if you were gonna speak up." she says. You notice she's got a thick Irish accent. "Uh, forgive me for asking but what kind of monster are you?" you ask. The girl laughs and pats your head. "I'm a leprechaun." she says. "My name's Goldie." Getting past that you remember that you need to find your daughter.

"Now its my turn to ask questions." Goldie says before you can say anything. "Who are you?" You stand up in her hand and introduce yourself. "My name is Neil Reaver. My daughter is a student here and I kind of got stuck in her bag. We got separated and I'm trying to find her." you explain. "Whoa whoa, wait. You're a human and you have a monster for a daughter?" she says. "Well, it was sort of a miracle,." you tell her. "Wow you're a lucky guy all right." Goldie tells you. "More than you know, if you hadn't come at the right time I might have been Ms. Keys new test subject." you say. Goldie chuckles. "Well I'm glad to help." You get back to the matter at hand and ask for her help. "Do you think you could help me find my daughter?" you ask. You're unsure of the teachers, so Goldie is your best bet. "Sure, but after class. I can't be late." she says.

While Goldie sits through her class you find yourself extremely bored. It reminds you of why you're glad you're done with high school. While the teacher drones on you're in Goldie's bag. When the lesson ends she takes you out and begins searching for your daughter. "So do you have a pot of gold?" you ask her. "Yes actually. Everyone in my family has their own." she answers. "So if I catch you then you have to give it to me?" you joke. The giant leprechaun leans her face in close and gives you a stare. "Do you think you can manage to capture me?" she asks in a mock threatening tone. "Okay, point taken." you say with a laugh. "I think I'm to old to be trying to catch a young girl like you anyway." Its at that moment the bell rings for the end of the day. "Shoot! I need to get to work!" Goldie says. She looks down at you in her palm guiltily. "I'd feel a little bad if I didn't help you after I said I would." she tells you. What does she do?
15532.title: One Of The Not So Wee Folk

155321.content:
"Tell you what, I'll take you to the principal or a teacher and they can help you out." Goldie offers. You think for a second and shudder at the images in your mind. You don't really feel safe around most of the teachers in this school. Then there's the principal, Ms. Wayne, who you don't know anything about. Sapphire says she's nice, but that might only be because she hasn't done anything to get sent to her office. "Um, I'm not too sure about that." you say. "A lot of the staff here don't really think much of humans." Goldie sighs and looks away for a second. "I'm really sorry, but I can't be late for work." Then she looks back at you with an idea. "I know, if you're scared of staying here I can just take you to work and we can call your family from there." That sounds good, you can just get Maggie to pick you up from Goldie's job.

Soon you're on the dashboard of Goldie's car as she drives to work. "So where do you work?" you ask. "Oh just a little shoe shop." she answers. "How well does the store do? Most of the monsters I know don't even wear shoes." you say. "Well its a small shop, and we get by. Monsters like vampires and succubi wear shoes, and us leprechauns of course." she explains. As she says this she pulls into a parking lot near a chain of stores. She picks you up and gets out, heading for a store between two others. Upon entering you see aisles filled with shoes. Pretty impressive for such a small shop. "Okay, lets get you straightened out before I get any customers." Goldie says. She takes you to the back and picks up the phone. You give her Maggie's number and the call is made. Goldie explains everything and then hangs up. "Okay your wife said she'll be down to pick you up in about an hour. Until then just chill for a while." she says. "Thanks Goldie." you say.

A few minutes later Goldie is sorting shoes while you watch. You notice that every so often she opens a box and cleans a pair. "Are you a neat freak?" you ask. Goldie looks slightly embarrassed before answering. "Kind of. Its a leprechaun thing. Whenever I see dirty shoes I can't help but clean them." she tells you. "Is that why you work in a shoe store?" you ask. "No thats a coincidence." she says. "I just had to get a job somewhere because I'm too young to work in my family's pub." She continues to work as you ask more questions. "Whats your boss like?" you ask. "She's an elf, and she's really nice. She actually made some of the shoes we sell." Goldie says. This goes on until...
155321.title: To The Shoe Store

choices: One Of Her Special Customers Arrives
1553211.content:
You hear a door opening and look up to see a tall buxom elf woman with short brown hair coming from a door in the back. "Hey Goldie, when did you get here?" she asks as she walks closer. "Oh I just got here." Goldie replies. She goes back to sorting the inventory as her boss walks closer. She doesn't notice you on the floor where Goldie is crouching and you have to dodge her giant feet. You quickly dive out of the way of her shoes and land on your stomach. You gaze upward at the woman standing next to Goldie. Its remarkable just how much they look like humans. "So how are things with you?" the woman asks. "Well at school today found a human. He got lost looking for his daughter who, weird enough, is a monster." Goldie says. "Did you help him find her?" her boss asks. "No actually, so I brought him..." Goldie starts before dropping the shoes she's holding. She then frantically searches the floor until she finds you. "Geez! I thought I lost you Mr. Reaver!" she says relieved. "Don't worry. I had to dodge some shoes but I'm fine." you say.

"Oh did I almost step on you?" Goldie's boss says as she bends down to pick you up. "Its nothing I'm not used to." you tell her. Goldie meanwhile is cleaning off the shoes she dropped. "Well my name is Cordelia, and I'm sorry for almost crushing you." she says. "No problem." you say. At that moment the bell on the front door rings and Goldie gets up to greet the customer. "While she's helping them I guess I'll watch you." Cordelia says. The two of you head to the back while Goldie deals with the customer. "So why are you here with Goldie?" she asks. "She helped me out when I got lost in the school and now I'm just waiting for my wife to pick me up." you explain.

While you and Cordelia chat she sets you on a table while she starts to go through some stock. You get a good look at her round bottom as she does so. "So did you really make some of these shoes?" you ask. "Yes, its sort of a hobby of mine." she says. "Some of my work is out there with the rest of the inventory, but I also get some special requests." She's now going over some paperwork but still keeps an eye on you. "So you must be pretty good for them to want you personally." you say. Cordelia blushes and sits down at the table. "Oh no, I'm nothing special really." she says. "I'm kind of nervous about my work, thats why I can only make shoes at night." The two of you continue to talk until...
1553211.title: The Elf Shoemaker

choices: Sapphire Invites Goldie To A Sleepover With Her Other Friends
15532112.content:
Just as you and Cordelia finish your little chat the door opens at the front of the store. Soon Goldie comes back and comes over to pick you up. "Your wife is here, Mr. Reaver." she says. You hop into her hand and she carries you to the front. Cordelia follows, wanting to see your wife. When you get there Maggie snatches you up and gives you a big wet kiss. "How in the world did you end up here?" she asks. "Well, I guess one thing just led to another." you tell her. Maggie rolls her eyes and looks at Goldie and Cordelia. "Thank you so much for taking care of my husband. He's got a habit of ending up in strange places." she says. "Don't mention it." Goldie says. "I must admit though, I didn't expect his wife to be the sheriff. Who would have though such a small guy would be married to one of the biggest monsters." Cordelia says. Maggie and you both look at each other and chuckle. "We get that a lot." you say.

"Well I guess I should get this little troublemaker home." Maggie says and turns to leave. "Wait!" Cordelia says. "Actually I'd like to know if you would want a pair of shoes. I've never made them for a human, so I think it would be a challenge." You think for a second and agree. "Sure, I kind of want to see your work." you tell her. "Okay, but don't expect anything too great." she says humbly. Goldie butts in and rolls her eyes. "Don't listen to her, she's awesome!" she says. You and Maggie exit the store while Cordelia blushes and tries to quiet Goldie. "Just come tomorrow and they'll be done!" Cordelia calls out before you go. "Well did you enjoy your little adventure?" Maggie asks with a smirk. "Hey, its not like I did it on purpose." you counter. She lifts you up for a kiss and then gets in the car. When you're secure she drives home. "At least I get a free pair of shoes." you say.

The next day you head to the shop to pick up your shoes. Maggie drives while Sapphire holds you in the passenger seat. When you arrive you all head inside and see Goldie. "Oh hey Mr. Reaver." she says. Cordelia comes from the back and sees you as well. "Oh! I'll go get your shoes now." she says and walks away. While she's gone Sapphire and Goldie start talking. "So you're the elusive daughter huh?" Goldie says. "Your dad went through a lot looking for you." Sapphire laughs a little. "Yeah...well thank you for helping him." Sapphire responds. "Is that your car out there? I wish I had one." she tells Goldie. The two of them get better acquainted while you wait for Cordelia. What next?
15532112.title: Maggie Arrives

155321121.content:
"So Goldie, would you like to hang out sometime?" Sapphire asks. "Sure, I'd like to get to know you better." the leprechaun answers. The two girls start to bond when Cordelia comes out with your shoes. "Here they are!" she announces. They look great and fit perfectly. "I think this may be the best pair I've ever had!" you tell her. She blushes and waves you off. "Please they're nothing really." she says. After some small talk you and your family leave. Before you go however Sapphire speaks to Goldie. "So would you like to come over to our house this weekend?' she asks. "Yeah that would be great." Goldie answers. Then an idea hits your daughter. "Oh I know! I'll invite my other friends so you can meet them too! We'll even have a sleepover!" Then she looks at you and Maggie with big kitty cat eyes. The two of her tell her its okay, and she tells Goldie to come over on Friday. When the three of you are in the car Sapphire gives Maggie a hug and you a kiss. "Thank guys! This is gonna be great!" she says. "I think Goldie will be a good friend dear." Maggie tells her.

Friday night arrives and the doorbell rings. Sapphire answers and finds Onyx at the door. "Looks like you're the first one here!" Sapphire tells her. The lioness girl enters and soon the rest of the guests arrive. One by one they enter, until finally everyone's there. When Maggie comes out of the kitchen with you in hand she gets their attention. "Okay girls, we'll stay out of your hair, so have fun!" Maggie says. "Yeah, and just make sure you all watch where you step." you add. "Okay, thanks guys!" Sapphire says as you and Maggie leave the room. Once they're alone the girls all relax, plopping onto the couch and floor. They put a movie on and begin talking. "So this is Goldie guys." Sapphire says, introducing her newest friend. "She helped my dad out the other day." Everyone introduces themselves and hit it off pretty well. Pearl walks up to her and looks her over. "You said you're a leprechaun right?" she asks. "Uh, yeah." Goldie answers. Pearl looks up and notes the height difference. One of her eyes twitches for a moment and she gets an angry look, but then takes a breath and sighs.

While watching the movie the girls continue getting to know Goldie. "So do you really have a pot of gold?" Onyx asks her. Goldie laughs and rolls her eyes before answering. "I get that question a lot, but yes. Everyone in my family has their own pot of gold." she says. "Ruby leans forward. "So how does that work?" she asks. Her two heads each say part of the sentence. "Well, I got mine when I was about thirteen. My mom said I had to make sure I keep it safe, and it was tradition." Goldie says. "Do you keep it at the end of a rainbow?" Pearl asks. "Not exactly." the leprechaun tells her and leaves it at that. Through the conversation the movie has ended and Sapphire puts on another. Next they...

info.brief_description: You're a human out in the boonies with a monster family. This is your not so normal life.
info.description:
(9/21/2016: Under new management. Originally created by RedHurricane)

You are Neil Morpheus Reaver, a human living in the monster town of Dreadberry. Youâve adapted well to the situation and even married a monster native of the town. Youâve been living in Dreadberry for twenty years, but you still get into trouble as with every human who chooses to live in the monster world. Then again, a lot can happen when you live in the monster equivalence of the sticks.

Family Members

Name: Maggie Reaver
Species: Nemean Lion
Height: 1000ft
Appearance: An obese white furred humanoid lioness with light blonde hair and bright green eyes. Mainly wears a green unitard. Maggieâs skin and fur is as hard as steel, not even a nuke could wound her.
Description: Maggie is your wife. Even though lion based monsters prey on humans, Maggie doesnât have a mean bone in her body and while she has a big appetite, humans are the one thing that she wonât eat. Though she can be ferociously protective of both you and Sapphire and isnât afraid to roar. Maggie is also Dreadberryâs sheriff and sheâs the best theyâve ever had, which makes you feel extremely safe with her.

Name: Sapphire Reaver
Species: Mer-Lion
Height: 900ft
Appearance: A heavyset teenage lioness with cyan scaly skin of a fish, gills on her neck and long blue hair. Despite being half-human, she shares the same species with her great-grandmother and the only thing noticeably human about her is that she has your eyes. Body wise, she resembles a mer-lion version of her mom.
Description: Sapphire is your and Maggieâs daughter that you somehow managed to sire. Despite being much bigger than you, Sapphire has never given you any trouble. In fact, sheâs a model daughter who always tries to be as perfect as she can be. But because of this, she is usually stressed out over matters such as schoolwork. While Sapphire loves you, she is somewhat embarrassed by the fact that her father is so tiny.

Name: Cattleya Reaver
Species: Splintercat
Height: 800ft
Appearance: Cattleya resembles a chubby, brown reddish furred lynx with a humanoid face and long brown hair with a white streaked ponytail. Being a Splintercat, Cattleya has a head as hard as a rock and the largest butt youâve ever seen, even bigger than either of her daughtersâ.
Description: Cattleya is Maggieâs mother (Maggie gets her species from her late father you never met). While she loves her daughters and granddaughter, Cattleya is a horrible mother-in-law. The woman just plain hates humans, especially you because she thinks Maggie couldâve done better. As a result sheâs out to make your life a living nightmare. At one point she even tried to eat you, though she prefers to torture you by trying to crush you.

Name: Fiona Reaver
